do not be fooled by the ferry corstens awesome remix of william orbits barbers adagio for strings track this does not at all represent william orbits cd this cd is almost entirely slow ambient takes on classical music
i was surprised to see that the editorial reviews on this album were so negative i think this is a beautiful album it is peaceful yet haunting definitely a relaxer

it did not have to be dance music or even upbeat what it should have been was good like all the rest of william orbits music i have heard this album was just awful do not waste your money if you want to hear wo at his best get strange cargo iii or madonnas ray of light

i can totally understand how many reviewers have raked this album over the coals it is very different especially if you are used to classical music the way it was originally written but what is wrong with doing things differently i am 39 and started listening to classical music when i was 9 i do not mind hearing different interpretations of old classics i think orbits interpretations are pretty innovative and unique yes there are some tracks that are not very strong but that is typical of all albums track 8 xerxes has been getting some air play on spinnercom and that is how i got introduced to orbits cd it is definitely the best track on the cd if you like mythos tangerine dream and other electronic new age you will like this cd

that your parents bought you when you were ten that were capable of producing only cheesy sounds this album reminded me of those I am serious I am really familiar with most of this music and orbit completely distroys what makes the music special and beautiful it is possible to revamp classical music electronically just listen to the techno mix of orffs o fortuna from carmina burana it rocks orbit just falls flat and puts me to sleep in the meantime do yourself a favor spend the money you would spend on this cd and buy some actual barber or beethoven or ravel or cage

although i could liken it to jean-michel jarre or vangelis it is true i will not because i believe that to be most unfair william orbit has metamorphisized eleven classical pieces into newer lighter soundscapes nothing tempts the soul like a door to the heavens and that is where i feel orbit has triumphed feeling as if an angel is carrying you along to perhaps an internal epiphany you can lay down and exist and leave all your mortal worries behind yet it is not dull or inconsequential in the slightest no this music holds intrinsic beauty pulled out of the original classical artists intentions it can make one cry or sigh in relief it is that human interpretation of beauty and nature and rhythm that can stike our senses dumb think of this work as valuable to own and enjoy and feel

rolling stone magazine dubbed pieces in a modern style as being a rare bridge between pop and classical after listening to and enjoying this album many times i have yet to disagree with that fine observation the 11 beautiful classic compositions in the tracks of this cd are transformed into modern-day masterpieces orbits lust for subtle ambient sound is fully satiated in these works as he presses onward for that perfect sound not once although does he betray the original flare of these pieces some tracks are simple barbers adagio for strings others more intricate saties ogive number 1 and still others bold and inventive mascagnis calleveria rusticana ravels pavane pour une infante defunte beethovens triple concerto however all these are facsinating engrossing works although classical enthusiasts are probably disgusted by this album i think all open-minded lovers of pop-music or music as a whole can find this bridge between pop and classical to be quite enchanting

i was not sure if i was going to like this one when i first bought the cd but i must say i was pleasantly surprised i had only heard of william orbit from his contributions to madonnas ray of light album and i am not a huge fan of electronica I am more into sarah maclaughlin and tori amos i do enjoy listening to classical music on occasion although so i thought I had give this one a try i really liked it the music has almost a celestial feel to it it shimmers and radiates and resonates into a pure crisp wall of sound the arrangements are very peaceful and calming when you listen to this cd you can feel the stress emptying from your bodyand if you close your eyes you feel like you are floating on wave after wave of sheer sound the music is at times blissful other times upbeat sometimes melancholy but always enjoyable admittedly this cd is probably not for everyone if you are open-minded to new things and are not some kind of strict classical music purist you might like this cd it is different unique and very relaxing give it a try

I am not quite sure what album miss maxine listened to when she reviewed pieces in a modern style but it is not the one I am listening to now quite honestly I am not an avid classical music listener and have not heard these pieces as each of the original composers intended I am sure but that does not matter this record is a beautiful albeit subtle masterpiece which is yet to disappoint me it is rich in creativity and originality

i listen to everything but country and this is definetly very nice and I am glad to have it and listen to it based on the bad reviews by critics you got to have it it is a very nice interpretation of classics which i happen to like alot not as intense as some of the pure classical musicians like anne-sophie mutter but williams orbits skill and originally and creativity sell this one and make it quite enjoyable I am not sure whether to organize this with my electronic cds or classical cds but I am glad someone is willing to straddle the line without regard for pleasing either crowd

this album was interesting back in 1968 it was called switched on bach by wendy carlos i was hoping for a record that would expand upon the innovations of 20th century music while adding a fresh twist to the classics what i got was a set of admittedly well-produced midi tracks where has the innovation

i tried i really tried i took him to work with me i listened to him as i drove through the mountains i gave him my undivided attention on the headphones in the living room but try as i might there has not much good i can say about pieces in a modern style purists will be aghast at the electronic reworking of compositions by ravel beethoven handel and others the ambient crowd will yawn with boredom at the undoubtedly high-tech production that goes out of it is way to sound low-tech the result unless you really want to see what pouty posturing synth artists lose the cover art already do when they decide it is time to make serious music stay away you can find better electronic music you can find better classical music taken together neither side wins here

buy this cd if you want to take a listen to a modern take on some interesting and very very well played music sadly some of the pieces have been played better tomita et al still it looks like most people would probably want the 2 cd edition that has the atb remix on cd 2
if u like clasical but is not that invovled or do not want to be away from pop too much heres a perfect alternative half-classical with some pop sensibilities

this cd was the worst cd i had ever bought the cd was also very very boring william orbit should made all the songs faster and not-so-long the only good thing about this cd is that the second disk which is a remix but the remix cd only contains two tracks but they are ok overall this cd is just garbage and a waste of money people who like instrumental music that really is boring this is the cd for you

this is what music should be tending towards a sythesis of styles it blends some of the most beautiful sounds together with production work that can not be done on a concert hall stage the final result is something that holds dear to your emotion

the sound of this album takes the sort of synthesizerrealizations of classical music isao tomita was doing in the 1970s and1980s and goes nowhere with it comparing isao tomitas 1984 realization of pavane pour une infante defunte from the ravel album issued as bolero in the united states with orbits realization of the same piece from this album reveals not only tremendous similarity but also a much more evocative clear and varied musical palette in the earlier rendition indeed pieces in a modern style falls into the sort of sound-cloud excesses that marred even some of tomitas best albums like firebird the planets and the bermuda triangle indeed pieces in a modern style is a veritable sequel to tomitas worst album by far dawn chorus if you are interested in how synthesizers can be used to interpret classical music in interesting ways try one of tomitas albums the recently re-released snowflakes are dancing is delightful or virtually anything by wendy carlos but let mr orbits endless fake synth-string washes fall deservedly into the remainder bins end

totally disappointed do not get me wrong i really like experimental music and thought mobys play was the best cd of 1999 but this experiment simply does not work if you are a big fan of orbits as i am you will be sorely disappointed this is not a cd to be tossed aside lightly it should be thrown with great force i suppose it is ok to listen to if you are in a coma completely awful

if you have come to william orbit via ferry corsten great but beware do not expect more of the same i mean do not get me wrong the remix of adagio is one of the most uplifting dance tunes of recent times this cd is at the other end of the scale but in genre and bpm terms not quality it shows through that william has spent much time and effort subtly recrafting classical tracks of yesteryear into chill-out soothers for the future i must admitt that upon my first listen i dismissed it as being too light but further listens meant i began to uncover the subtle tapestry of what he has tried to create for instance i think ludwig beethoven himself would approve of the downbeat re-working of triple concerto classical lovers may turn their nose up at this dance nutters likewise but if you are not adverse to a bit of genre meshing then give this a try although not an all-time ambient classic it is definitely worth taking this trip

it is worth remembering as you drift spellbound through theshimmering fantasyscapes of william orbits remarkable new cd pieces in a modern style that this is not terra incognita classical music was once electronicas proving ground wendy carlos aka walter carlos stunned the pop and classical culture alike in the late 60s with the energetic and appealingly appropriate switched-on bach an exploration of johann sebastians linear meditations through bob moogs primitive analog sequencers that seemed to go well with beanbag chairs and philip roth and all things postrevolutionary

so this is not a dance cd so what it is a really interesting treatment of modern classical music i really like the pieces by john cage and henryk goreki as a musician this shows orbits incredible shill and i found it interesting and great to listen to why should an artist do the same thing over and over if you want dance music buy strange cargo whatever number if you want to hear something new and interesting try this cd
this album should be called tunes that you recognize played a cheap keyboard none of the tracks are very exciting and most just sound cheap and tacky

okay i happen to own strange cargo cds and i like them i own isao tomitas albums as well yes the man who has been playing classical music on synthesizers since 1974 and yes i like them all pieces however gets it all wrong the album tracks are boring the most interesting track the remix of barbers adagio in not on the cd at all but on a single if you can compare pavane from orbit with the version played by tomita back in 1979 on the ravel album daphnis et clo while orbits version seems flat tomita playes the same work with much more emotion if you like classics played on keyboards you should really check out tomitas work if you expect to find anything like water from a vinestrange cargo 3 then do not buy this album

having owned many and heard most of these pieces in the original form I have found orbits interpretations refreshing and insightful they will introduce a whole new audience to a genre that badly needs more listeners yet they stand on their own in feeling and creativity i think orbit deserves credit for taking this lateralthe production is first rate and his choice of melodies is to my mind excellent

i think this cd is wonderful it is definitely orbit even classical composers often create arrangements of other composers works or themes often times intended for other instruments so it is really not a valid review to imply that a new arrangement is simply not valid you have to appreciate orbits cd as an expression of his style just as you would not compare a performance of rachmaninoffs variations on a theme of paganini to a performance of the original score it would not even make sense

I have always felt that really good techno has many elements of classical music in it and it seems odd that it would take so long for one of the techno crowd to try their hand at remaking classical music the results are beautiful yet tasteful and not exploitative of the material there are some missteps some of the tracks in a landscape for instance veer off into sounding like a music major noodling on a cheap casio keyboard and others adagio are a little to respectful to be authentic however the others are terrific xerxes is beautiful and some of the other arrangements are really chancy and inspired i enjoy listening to the cd tremendously and so do several of my friends who hate techno

i bought this cd before reading the review on amazon however even if i had i probably would have made the purchase anyway that said it is undeniably the worst piece of crumpled recycled techno-classical music imaginable if you have a collection of the most awful music you have ever heard this is an absolute must have if you do not steer very clear of this disk

alas the original amazon review is correct this album is well produced but also very kitch beethoven in ambient soup is almost as bad as smoke on the water sung by pat boone i think that orbit could have made a much better album by reinterpreting open jazz standards i believe that there is no need to rearrange pieces of classical music that are perfect and complete in themselves so i can only explain this cd as a cash-in operation after the successful madonna album my humble advice is to those who like easy-listening classical music buy the originals classical cds are often sold at a bargain price since they provide a much pleasant authentic listening experience to those who are curious about ambient buy any cd of the orb or boards of canada or plaid or even the classic eno

we think this album rocks we were in the uk for christmas when the adagio was number one and it should be released in the us if you like techno we would thorouhgly recommend this as techno with a tune and excellent for turning up really loud if you like this try sash too

he has original how many electronic musicians can you say ah that sounds like william orbit he has his signature sounds he writes his own stuff and has his own respectable back-catalog but where is the first torch song album on cd he has got friends in high places he has sexy ok not but the album is kind of dull and lacks feeling you want emotion electronica with emotion someone may have beaten me to this already because i see others that bought pieces have also bought but check out global communication 7614 the original german pressing of this album had some arvo part tracks that did not make it on this release but kudos to bill for simply doing something he wanted to do now where has the next single with club 69 mixes

supermaket version of classical favourites adds nothing worthwhile to the original pieces why does mtv europe run the adagio for strings video without telling us that it is a remix not to be found on the normal album i want a refund

i have been listening to tot since velvet it is hard to believe this is the same band they have gone from the death-goth stylings of velvet to the beautiful aegis and now to the techno / metal / goth hybrid if you are a metal purist you probably will not find anything you like about this disc if you an open minded music lover you will find that every track is totally stunning i listen to mine driving at night with the windows down in a big city absolutely amazing

i must say as a huge fan of this group i was immensly dissappointed with this new disc this is not the good tot it is some attempt at something from out of clear left field if you liked the old tot do not by this disc if you like techno / electronica let us play the same mundane beat over and over again then this disc may be for you for those of you who need to fill the void for this lackluster performance try the new release oracle moon by garden of shadows killer riffs tons of time changes beautiful keyboards just downright good music

rating this album is somewhat hard because there is a big change of style here by tot i would recommend to those that loved tot for their metal-gothic style to maybe pass on this one also if they do not like techno or a somewhat ramstein-ish music style but for those that are willing to accept change form their favourite group they might be positively impressed by the change here they have gained a more techno feel while still keeping their metal roots ala ramstein and liv voice is still as angelic as ever even through this techno sounbds the problem is that they may seems to have lost their gothic touch but personally i think it just transcended into something different but no totally un-gothic to sums it up for those willing to see change not necessarily as a bad thing i would recommend this album but for those maybe older fans who are not so open to change i would not recommend this one because it is too different from their previous albums i was not prepare for such a change on this album when i bought it but i still loved it music is an art i think keeping an open mind is a must

a longtime fan of this group i was elated to see that they had finally released a new album elated that is until i tried listening to it i am not a purist and do not insist that everything i listen to be true metal but this is simply inexcusable this once great band has degenerated into yet another factory for watered down euro-pop trash causing them in my mind to have ceased to exist do not buy this album instead i highly recommend that you purchase any other album by this band or perhaps something by tristania or the sins of thy beloved assuming goth metal is what you are after i mourn the loss of this band and hope that others like it do not follow the same path to utter corruption

what happened it just all went so wrong I am sure there has people out there who might like this album but he shall i sure prefer their other albums over this one this one sounds more how shall i say club-ish

aegis was the turning point you could tell that it was somewhat different than the other albums even although the aegis album is one of my favorites they all are with the exception of musique i mean it is like another band and i really really loved the old stuff because of the passion put into it this album just did not have that

seems like most people like to on tot for this album but this album is what got me to take them seriously until this album tot was exactly like every other goth / doom / metal band out there decent heavy metal parts growly male vocals pretty female vocals lots of gothy stuff unbelievable cheese-filled lyrics sure they were the leaders of the pack but the pack was cheesy and predictable this concept album changes everything elements of old tot are still there the heaviness livs pretty vocals the good song writing but they show influences from the best of techno / industrial why techno / industrial cuz it works with the concept of this album I am willing to bet that the next album will be quite different and have totally new concepts of course if they stay in this direction for awhile i will not be complaining it is called creativity people that is a good thing

this is a great album it does not sound like their earlier albums often it is assumed that when a band experiments in order to grow because they have mastered something thay have sold out not true this is album along with ageis are my favorites liv kristines voice is absolutly wonderful she is one the few singers with a truely extraordinary voice and you can hear her clearly the music is great and defintly has a great rythm and force behind it the music has a crystalline kind of sound like it has surpassed basic levels and gone to a higher plane wich may sound weird but it is absolulty awe inspiring

i was excited for this album to come out i hate it this could possibly be the most disappointing cd I have ever heard why does raymond want to sound like a robot version of the guy from the b-52s if you want my honest opinion theatre of tragedy need to get off their high horses their sell-out may have even surpassed metallicas has anyone been to their website lately talk about a bunch of ego-driven jerks I am into metal that has a groove but I had still like it to be intelligent i also like it when people play instruments why are not the guitar players in this band bored there has more programming in this cd than there is in windows 2000 i do not know what possessed them to make an album like this but they need an exorcist badly it is sad when a hard core theatre of tragedy fan like me just does not care anymore i do not know what they are up to these days probably playing dance clubs and sadly i do not care i am one of too many incredibly disappointed ex-fans

i am among many other various music styles a big listener of lacrimosa and therion which i consider to be pathfinder in the chaotic musical universe of the last years their music is qualitative very high rich and listenable these are things i unfortunately can not say about this tot album first problem the band creates an unnecessarly wall of sound much to loud i do not think that gothic means play it loud unlistenable and which is covering by 50 the vocals second problem the techno-pop section is far from being original copying electro-pop bands from the 80s there are entire passages you could swear they are from kraftwerk a-ha or others third problem i think there must be a limit of mixing different music styles while it is proven that classic-rock classic-metal or opera-metal is working very good i do not think that techno-pop / metal or any other dance-metal will have any succes it sounds to me like trying to enter the limp biskit family and i am not interested to follow the tot in there

i am a new convert to the black metal i use that term loosely after listening to this cd genre and recently picked up this cd i was expecting more of a symphonic experience like tristanias beyond the veil i am disappointed with the premise that this album is listed in the black metal genre it belongs somewhere else preferrably electronica however I have heard that tots earlier work holds truer to the genre so I shall probably pick up an earlier tot album if you like synth-based music with a gothic twist the album is palatable i rated it two stars mainly for the disappointment of my own expectations not necessarily for the album itself i must now deal with the sadness of my own disappointment of course it could have been worse i could have actually picked up an a-ha cd

i came across this album via the vnv nation remix of machine i was hooked after about a minute of that track I have since heard some of tots earlier stuff but the musique album is by far the most enjoyable would have given 5 stars if vnv had mixed the entire album i had none of the goth pretensions to cloud my judgement i rate such bands as curve rammstein ministry along with much ebm / future-pop / synthpop oh yeah and kate bush too die-hard fans will no doubt flame this but i think musique is full of great pop songs at times it may veer into republica territory but the tech lyrics and beautiful female vox hold it up i only hope this band continue with this electro path in the future much like vnv nation this band get better with each release

the 2002 tony for best revival went to into the woods and it is well deserved this staging and album are both pure gold vanessa williams interpretation of the witch manages to be quite distinct from bernadette peters while maintaining the standard ms peters set back in 1987 although her velvet tones do strike you as a bit smooth for the character you can feel the underlying emotion in the larger numbers like the last midnight both laura benanti and kerry omalleys voices are quite beautiful and add new dimensions to the characters of cinderella and the bakers wife respectively benantis on the steps of the palace is much lighter and more girlish than kim crosby on the 1987 recording which is refreshing to a listener who has become so attached to the original recording the only reason i have not given this five stars is the quality of the recording itself in many places the recording feels a bit closed in as if you were in a small space almost drowning out the richness of many of the actors voices overall the recording breathes new life and energy in an already timeless musical and makes a welcome addition to any sondheim library

buy this cd it is defiantly worth it with all of the publicity surrounding this revival and this tony award winning castby vanessa williams and john mcmartin it is an amazing soundtrack this recording is inventively done and defiantly breathes new life into this score the new additions on this recording are the first american recording of our little world a duet between rapunzel melissa dye and the witch vanessa williams i would have bought the recording just for this song the new version of hello little girl is now sung by both wolves to ridinghood preserved on this recording along with many other tweaks to the score williams and mcmartin are absolutely fabulous breathing new life into there performances as well is veteran actress laura benanti kerry omalley and gregg edelmann while newcomers adam wylie and molly ephraim give a different twist on there characters and are very entertaining to listen to the performance of marylouise burke is the biggest letdown on this recording while this recording is nothing like the original headed by bernadette peters i think it is defiantly worth the chance because of the additional material by steven sondheim and jonathan tunick thanks for reading and buy this cd

oh my god i am a broadway fan and when i heard that vanessa williams would be playing the witch i could not wait to hear this cd and it took me along time to buy it because something kept telling me to wait and i waited and waited until now and i understand why although there is more to this cd than the first one i love the first cd to this show and even love love the dvd to into the woods a must buy but this it mite take me sometime to get use to but i do not think i will be picking it back up there is nothing like the first one and how grand it is and you get to this cd and it just do not work for me
i bought this because i was doing a cabaret that had into the woods as one of the shows shown even after the show is over i still can not stop listening to it

until i got this cd home i was unaware that this rewritten revival existed and i do wish i had continued in that state of happy ignorance if zombies on valium had been engaged to perform they could hardly have made the music more lifeless than this recording does i understand wanting to interpret roles anew but even new interpretations should be imbued with sparkle of some kind unless of course one is doing the aforesaid druggie zombie version i bought this cd at a local store and back it goes if anyone wants to see a lovely version so much better than the 2002 broadway revival search youtube for into the woods cleveland hs the high school students are wonderful it is a pity their performance is not available here I had buy it

i would have given this recording one star except for the fact that the album is presented beautifully by nonesuch records i luckily found this cd used and only had to pay a few bucks for it i would have felt really cheated if i paid full price and got what i did while the orchestrations are beautiful and the additional song between rapunzel and the witch was nice to have this revival was lackluster it won a tony for best revival but must have been due to some other factor than individual performances my biggest bone to pick was vanessa williams as the witch she was boring and lacked the feeling and emotion that bernadette peters put into her performance granted it is hard to fill those shoes but she just was not anywhere near capable of this role she sang in tune and she hardly missed a beat but there was nothing there the only role i really liked more than the original cast was cinderella she was amazing and earned her acclamations go buy the original cast recording or if you are looking for a good sondheim revival look into the 2006 london cast recording of sunday in the park with george

brilliant brilliant brilliant those familiar with sondheims dissonance with pay off and poetic lyricism will love this application to fantasy if you liked sweeney todd but want something lighter or liked company but want something more optimistic you will thrill at how well sondheim thrives through this happy medium as for preference in recording i can not yet help as i am still exploring them a major benefit to this recording is bernadette peters performance her voice is rich and her acting is so beneficial to sondheims theme and since she is the first to be recorded as the witch she has become the standard buy it go

stephen sondheim is a genius of musical theatre that is for certain into the woods is my all time favorite musical i was really excited to hear they were going to do a revival of it with vanessa williams as the witch sounds great right not so much vanessa is not as great as you hope and for some reason shephen thought it would be a goodto write new parts for almost every song or throw in every he cut from the first time to be perfectly honest this is the worst of the three recordings get the broadway or my favorite the london recording do not waste your money or time with this one
like many of the reviews i agree this revival is a disappointment as a fan of vanessa williams i think too it was a mistake for her to played the witch i enjoy original into the woods cast better

i have never understood the fascination so many have for this show I have seen it performed watched the dvd and have the cd I have spent hours trying to figure out why someone would call this good musical theatre i have seen more than 20 broadway shows own hundreds of musicals on cd and dvd i have tried to really like this musical but it is over dramatized stupid and lacks everything someone would want from a musical the characters are slow stupid there are a few comic moments but not enough to make the story a thought provoking jounrey i have not found a song yet on this cd that i truly enjoy no one is alone somehow manages to stand out but that is the only song i would listen to more than once all in all I had consider listening to a differant sondheim classic for this is just simply not his best

i realize that many people think that this cast is much worse than the original but i think they both have strengths i actually found that i enjoy this version of into the woods much more i find that this cd has a cleaner sound wonderful voices and the addition of funny lines are a real plus some differences i think that are well created were the harmony in on the steps of the palace and i thought that a very nice prince it takes two hello little girl and your fault were better in this version of the musical this album is wonderful and do not get me wrong that original is too and i would not suggest passing it up the songs are moving and an amazing feat in musical theater

to me into the woods is one of the most inspirational thought provoking musicals ever written and this recording does no justice to it in fact it belittles it i agree with another reviewer when they said it seems like a bad community theatre production of this masterpiece it seems like this production is more family-oriented the show may be comprised of childrens fairytales but it is in no way a family-oriented musical it has very adult situations and complex concepts as do other stephen sondheim musicals that are notsuitabl for children making it more family-oriented makes the usually genuine characters overdone that is vanessa williams interpretation of the witch and almost hokey cheapening the overall message i suggest buying the original cast recording from 1987 with bernadette peters and joanna gleason chip zein may be disappointing but you will not go wrong with that cd and if you like that one i recommend the original cast recordings of other amazing stephen sondheim shows such as sweeney todd the demon barber of fleet street sunday in the park with george and merrily we roll along
i love this musical this version of it is really the best a great cd for any age brings the cartoon charactors to life

i have been a fan of into the woods for a very long time now i am currently in a production of it i play jack and so i bought all 3 versions of into the woods orginal london revival i love all 3 as if they were my children so there is not a bad one i think that the orginal is great i mean cmon people bernedette peters the london one has the best baker I have ever heard but the revival has amazing music the best cinderella ever and same for jack and rapunzel i think people who give this cd bad reviews is because they wanted another joanna gleasoon bernedette peters production i think if you are a woods fan buy all three but if you are new to it buy this first then orginal then london

i first saw into the woods about five years ago a small theaterhouse where i live put it on from that moment i was totally entranced with the whole story i have not seen the revival nor have i seen the originals so i can not really compare the two still i got this soundtrack for my birthday and i have to say that I am fairly impressed i love it so much but certain things do get on my nerves it also annoys me although when people complain about the different people doing the characters whenever a play reopens there are going to be new interpretations of characters also complaining about the peoples voices is rather rude in my opinion unless you think you could do a better job recently some idiot scratched my cd blanking out the last three songs i like this cd so much that i am going to buy another copy which is the highest recommendation i can give

ok so nothing can beat burnedette peaters but this comes close this soundtrack is good but the acting is hit and miss baker and wife good but i like the original better narator someone please shoot this guy what is with the whole ok since the stageing is not as creepy as the old one i will make up for it i do not like him witch two different interpritations but still good either way prince better then before cinderella best ever casting jack ok is it posible that this part is played too young if it is i think he has done it little red good choice thesisters they do not have the comedic timing as the last group jacks mother why is she so old if jack is so young not that the actress is old she just sounds old the stepmother to annoying over all it is like the stageing has changed the music so much that if you are used to the original cast that you can not sing along the first time you hear it it is only annoying if you sing along with your music like i do i recomend this but i do not think it is the better of the two sorry

this play is amazing i saw the play a couple months ago and i just recently bought the soundtrack I am glad i did because i had forgotten all the amazing voices most especially i truly appreciate the voice of adam wylie as jack his song giants in the sky just makes me cry every time i hear it which is a lot because i listen to the song very frequently anyways molly ephraim is a great little red she has a very simple voice that will definetly please the audience the princes are very amusing with their agony and of course vanessa williams is a great witch she plays the part perfectly definetly buy this cd it is definetly not a waste of money or time
none of the principals hold a candle to the original this cd is a testimony to the sad state of broadway in one word if you want a recording of itw buy the original recording
sondheim has written a few beautiful songs but most of it is just tuneless melodies that arnt that good

this recording is a different animal from the original the cast all go in with fresh interpretations of the characters and the show has a different overall tone than the original at first i did not like this revival recording as i was so used to the original cast but i grew to love it once i got over the differences if you like this a must get is the original cast dvd hook it up to your stereo sit back and enjoywow

i bought this cd because I am a fan of sondheim in general and especially of woods however after seeing the revival production twice i knew this was going to be onedown from the original cast recording but i had high hopes alas even in the studio this cast can not come near to competing with it is successor the only cast members who hold their own are laura benanti and kerry omalley and even then it is difficult sitting through the other performances if you do not know the show yet by the original cast recording the only thing you would get out of this one would be the few changes that have been made if you really want to hear those make sure you get the other recording as well

i have seen this revival three times now in it is current run at the broadhurst theatre in new york and honestly it just keeps getting better this recording captures the new production well but of course what it can not capture are the actors expressions gestures and other nuances to my ear vanessa williams is actually better than i expected as the witch she has quite good really those with an astute ear will recognize the always-terrific pamela myers think another hundred people in sondheims masterwork company as cinderellas stepmother

a prospective buyer should be asking two questions 1 should i purchase a cast recording of into the woods and 2 should i purchase this recording in my view the answers are yes and no into the woods is a great great score that is wonderful to listen to over and over it just keeps getting better some say it is one of sondheims more accessible scores i do not know about that but it does not lack for richness and depth i think this version and the original cast are much closer than some of the other reviewers some actors are better in one or the other the key to me however is the role of the witch who sings a few of the most poignant songs in the show and here i give bernadette peters a bigover vanessa williams williams voice is pleasant and very professional but bland to my taste peters brings verve and passion to every note and her singing is the highlight of the original cast recording what has most important is that you get some version of this superb piece of musical theater

the 2002 revival of into the woods pales in comparison to the original 1987 production vanessa williams was not right for this role and she lacked the emotion needed for the part of the witch i kept waiting for bernadette peters wonderful voice to pop out of nowhere and stop vanessa williams from singing i would advise you not to buy this cd

very few revivals have matched the impact and quality of the original production the recent production of cabaret is the only one that springs to my mind this new into the woods is no exception james lapine has chosen to revamp his lyrics and tinker with some orchestrations but why nothing is really added that makes the show significantly better or even very different the new cast is for the most part adequate with the exception of the superb laura benanti but vanessa williams makes a poor replacement for the phenomenal bernadette peters but all that said and done it is still one of sondheims most beautiful scores and enchanting stories

i quickly went out and bought this recording after i was upset with myself for missing the shows run here in los angeles i hated myself even more after listening to it wonderful orchestrations and the cast is incredible it is as if this recording manages to express more of the characters traits and personalities we can read more into what type of people they are throughout the show without having to see them acting it out on a stage vanessa williams really is terrific sondheim just keeps getting better

wow i was not expecting this recording to be as good as the original one with bernadette peters the whole cast brings a rush of energy right through you vanessa williams is great she has a great witchy atittude which brings out a whole new her the bakers and his wife both are more young and have more angelic voices cinderellas voice is so calming and full filling the narrator has a great voice tom aldrege the sound quality is great everybody sounds wonderful as if they were onstage in front of you this is an absolute hit if you have seen the show than with out a doubt get this wonderful recording everybody is so joyful it will leave you singing and dancing to all the songs this is an absolute must

to say i was disappointed with this recording is an understatement having just completed an amateur production of into the woods i was glad my cast did not have the chance to over indulge in this recording quite frankly there is little in this recording worth recommending above other recorded versions of the work why bother altering the music for a show which was orginally so funny and poignant and why make the witch an aretha franklin wannabe and why is jacks mother so bored all these questions keep floating around my head as i take it in doubtless many will disagree and say it is better than the original but apart from a couple exceptions it really is nothing more than a curiosity i really really wanted to enjoy this recording but simply can not maybe i need to listen to it more or maybe i just object to the changes but this not worthy of the name sondheim my advice to performers preparing this work is to use the original or london casts and ignore this i can only dread what they did to the script

i think this revival broadway show is excellent it is amazing unforgettable the new version of the cd is also overwhelming fantastic i think the little riding hood played by molly ephraim was great just as innoncent as she can be my favourite jack the sad young lad played by adam wylie was a bravo his voice really fitted how i imagined jack to be all the casts are great but vanessa williams did not do as well as i expected she has got an excellent voice but her role the witch was a bit distracting considering the witch is evil and she did not really bring out that sense of villian only she looked a bit silly she still did a great job in the singing but her acting throughout the show was not as great as her voice overall the show is excellent and the music is awesome no doubt you will forget the ending of ever after

my title pretty much sums it up the original cast of into the woods was irreplacable and this attempt is contemptable i am so glad that i did not spend money to buy it or see it i feel sorry for the friend who did although i hear it is going out in her next garage sale if she can sell it if not it is going to good will

I am a huge fan of musicals i lvoe them all but none has ever held a candle to into the woods the revival cast is well to say the least very good however they lack the the well passion of the orginal cast the songs are sung a little absent of the chachters vanessa williams is weak as the witch she lacks the passion and luster bernadette peters brought to the role she has her finer moments thought among them stay with me and last midnight one of the finest perfomances on the disc is our little world a song from the london production added to the revival other highlights are the bakers wife cinderella and the wonderfully innocent little red the actress who play little red brings something new and fresh to the role and i think really perks it up the disc also comes with a wonderfull booklet of pictures and lyrics but do not attempt to follow along as the lyrics in the book are diffrent all in all it is worth buying but make sure you have the orginal first

if you are interested in listening to sondheims wonderful musical into the woods do not not buy this cd bernadette peters ia far more animated and charismatic as the witch in the original broadway cast recording with vanessa williams in the revival recording seriously lacking also jacks mother has no rhythm and the other parts are so far behind the spotless caliber of the original cast this cd is a waste of your money invest in the original

the new into the woods is a must have this new cast of into the woods took me completely by surpirse the new cast is almost as good as the original cast and vanessa williams shines as the witch but lacks some of the power that bernadette peters used to make the witch come alive i was afraid when i heard that sondheim had made a few changes to the show i believe that the original cast album is a gem the changes include 3 little pigs a second wolf minor alterations of words to a few songs like on the steps of the palace and the editon of our little world in act one the song was cut from the broadway production but appears on the london cast album these changes enhance the show which i thought was already perfect this is a must purchase if you love the original cast album you will not be disappointed

right off the bat if you are a country music fan this is not a country music cd i first saw lee ann at fan fare week in nashville a bright wonderful vocalist that took my breath away with her songs that was country there is not a single country music song on this cd if lee ann was going to change her genre midcareer she could have warned her fans her other releases were wonderful country music this is horrible as far as I am concerned lee ann has dyed her hair a bad job at that and changed her genre to a sort of blusie / jazz / pop type of thing and it does not work her talents are surely going to be wasted the last track 13 is an international release of the title track that is purely pop and intended to attract a new listening audience i suggest she release this cd on the pop side as it is a pitiful excuse for country music if this is the mature path in life that she has going down i will no longer be purchasing her cds

i listened to this album a few times already the only song that i really liked is something worth leaving behind the rest just does not seem like lee anns style i enjoy all of her other albums just this one is like she has trying to go to pop in my own opinion lee ann shines best in country music

the only great song on this album is something worth leaving behind the album is really all pop to me and not very good pop she needs to go back to her roots and do country again do not waste your money on this cd

having been a huge fan of lee anns since her debut back in 1996 i was anxiously awaiting this new release the first single something worth leaving behind is a masterpiece with it is lyrics and exceptional vocals the album has a much more laid back and relaxing sound than her previous efforts she takes you on a journey through her world this album is about love loss perseverance done with those amazing chops she possesses the highlights are something worth leaving behind i saw your light when you going to run to me i need you you should have lied and surrender not a bad album just let it grown on you

i love this cd i am really glad that amazon had it because i could not find it to purchase anywhere my favorite tracks are he will be back and forever everyday if you like leann womack you will love this cd

i think this album should have gotten more exposure the songs are very solid and so is lee ann womacks performance a few songs are not my cup of tea because the production and vocal performance is overly dramatic but this does not take away from lee anns talent some folks complain that the album are not country enough but all music forms need to evolve and diversify in order to stay relevant i know there was a lot of pressure to create an i hope you dance pt 2 but i think there is something very classy about this album something worth leaving behind at times feel ethereal i would give it 4 and a half stars if i could

if you are looking for country music try leeanns self titled release or something i know these are both great cds she has a perfect voice for country music strong with just the right amount of east tx twang this cd is for those celine dion fans who want to listen to adult contemporary music leeann has learned how to sell music to the masses and left country music fans longing for a return to her earlier sound

i have all of lee anns cds the first three are great but this one is awful it is not a country cd at all almost all the songs are bad pop songs her voice is really good so that makes the songs better than they could be but it is still not worth having buy her other cds instead

this is a timeless recording from lee ann womack from the title track something worth leaving behind to the oldtimey jazzy he will be back lee ann shows her amazing vocal talent in a wide range of country / pop style songs she has definatly proven that she can appeal to both country and pop music fans this cd is an amazing add to your collection and i highly recommend it

what an appropriate title as that is exactly what i am doing so sorry that such a great talent for traditional country has sold out to the nashville establishment it is very disappointing when the record producers just do not get it did not they notice who dominated the cma awards this year you will never hear alan jackson recording something as mediocre as this lee ann womack attempt at copying faith hill
this has to be the worst cd i have purchased for a long timei have loved leeanns other albums but this one is truly awful

i loved her first cd and her second one was pretty good i liked the country part of i hope you dance but this cd really has nothing to offer a country fan the only country sounding thing here is a patsy cline type song called he will be back something worth leaving behind is a pretty good song but the version on track 13 should have been the only one on the cd i like it better than the radio version as a christian i really did not like jesus mentioned as just someone in history he is our saviour and our god i hope others do not waste their time / money on this cd let us send lee ann a message that we want her to get back to singing the classic style of country that she does so well

the very first time i played this cd i listen to it at a very moderate volume and thought all the cuts sounded the same subesequently after many listening sessions i totally retract my original statement after her last spectacular releasei hope you dancei felt it would be a impossible act to follow once again i was way off base some of the melodies sounded very fimilar at the beginning of some of the cuts but they immediately flowed into new material when you going to run to me and surrender were teriffic when i heardshould have lied it absolutely grabbed my sole it was so powerful this women is a genuine super star do not pass this new release up it is a winner

talk about your sell outs i do not like country singers that go pop go back to your country roots lee ann i want something that is meaningful like patty lovelesss mountain soul not pop drivel like what you and faith hill having benn pumping out the last couple of years your last 2 releases do not come close to the quality of your first 2

this album is certainly a change for lee ann womack but it is a shift away from where her talent lies her vocals are still beautiful but something worth leaving behind is a dull pop-rock crossover exercise with leaden production and songs that are I shall-suited to the artists stylistic strengths lee ann womack seems to be doing everything she can both musically and image-wise to suppress everything that made her original and exciting when she first came on the scene a waste of talent

after the huge disappointment of kelly willis easy it was a massive relief to find one established artist who was still on top form from the opening title track right through to the last this album was an unalloyed joy there is nothing second-rate here the songs the musicianship the arrangements the production and above all the great vocals of lee ann womack are immensely accomplished all the tracks stand out with the title track and blame it on me as perhaps the most commercial it is only too sad that others in this overcrowded sector fail to reach miss womacks standard forget kelly willis forget allison moorer this is the real thing buy it

i have been a lee ann fan since day one the first concert i saw her in she said if you do not like country you do not belong here well lee ann what happened to you there is only one country song on this entire cd i am very disappointed with this production

i did not think she could top i hope you dance but it has happened using a different sound and style-she delivers yet another masterpiece i see album of the year in her future with more female vocalist of the year awards coming her way

this cd shows that lee ann womack can do anything it is mostly not country but it is haunting lively and very emotional this may be the best combo of country and top notch pop that i have ever heard and really shows off lee anns beautiful soprano voice it is certainly the best crossover of any country singer every song is great but you should have lied should be no 1 on the charts country and pop

three chords and a it-all attitude personified the band these covers are at times blissfully reminiscent of that successful formula eddie vedder and zeke pulling down i believe in miracles and daytime dilemma andode to beat the brat are some of the best sendon this disc other big-time notable efforts include those by the offspring i want to be sedated green day outsider and the pretenders something to believe in nowhere in fact is there an uninspired or at least original rendition with the exception of marilyn manson who sounds as although he recorded his cut in the vacuum of space meaning without the benefit of oxygen flowing to his lungs oh and steven king does the liner notes in a style befitting of the master of horror who also happens to be a bit of a headbanger himself it is a fondly irreverent preface to one of the better tribute albums I have had the pleasure of hearing

welcome to the world of tribute albums this land is becoming more and more visited in recent years we are a happy family is definately one of the best tribute albums I have heard every track seems to have a new twist rob zombie did a fantastic job with this project and seemed to capture the essense of the ramones i recomend this to any ramones fan as well as the younger generation who has not yet had a chance to listen to them this album provides an array of fantastic songs which willyou through the music that the ramones have given to us

compiled by rob zombie and ex-ramones guitarist johnny ramone we are a happy family has it is moments but is a mere shadow of what it could have and should have been as for what has good do you remember rock n roll radio is an interesting addition to kiss discography the ultimate 70s arena rock band finally embraces punk as they once embraced disco however briefly in both instances tom waits as always is a hoot on the return of jackie and judy and metallica green day and rancid all serve up various tracks competently unfortunately the album could have been a lot better for one thing few of the acts onboard have been regarded as anything like cuttingsince about 1995 for another few of the ramones contemporaries were tapped for contributions where are the dictators blondie heck johnny ramone has admitted in interviews that the cramps were asked to provide a song which was left off at sonys insistence for budgetary reasons memo to johnny ramone joey would have hung tough

we have been needing wanting and waiting for this cd for too long fabulous production to have kiss u2 along with expected tributees-green day rancid was a surprise but it works with the volume of work the ramones have this should be an ongoing project to include an even wider diverse group of musicians congratulations on this wonderful cd and let us see if interest can be generated for volume 2 thanks we needed this

this is a great cd brought to you from the twisted mind of rob zombie and it well rocks i may not be a ramones fan but the artists in this cd have great performances especially metallicas cover of 53rd and 3rd great and also kisss cover rock n roll radio the offspring and chili peppers also have great performances buy this album it is sure to please even the not so diehard fan

excellent record with an incredible collection of artists great interpretations of the original songs especially mansons dark and slow version of the kkk took my baby away eddie vedder delivers the most authentical performances and in my opinion the best ones ok I am a serious peal jam fan get at least two of this must have record phm

the big surprises here come from the bands that have the least in common musically with the ramones the peppers are great tom waits is fantastic rom zombie has a great bop-version the female vocals of garbage and the pretenders are very refreshing and big names like u2 metallica and kiss deliver very well the least remarkable covers are those of green day offspring and rancid they stick too close to the originals and we already have those of course nobody can beat the ramones at their own game but this tribute album is well worth your money
ramones were a happy family tribute was great the kiss track was by far the best

do not know what has with the revisionist reviews I have had this album for years and have loved songs from it for years yeah you can pass on marilyn manson and some of the others but u2 garbage the pretenders kiss and the offspring kick it I am not much into rob zombie metallica or green day but they do a good job too bottom line this is a great album for some of the songs covers are just that they do not replace the original so what do you expect here u2 puts a new spin on beat on the brat had to grow on me but the guitars rock garbage is just fantastic kiss rule the world as usual and offspring make a pretty good replication of i want to be sedated with enough variation to make it memorable oh and i forgot red hot chili peppers another band i do not listen to do a great job on havana affair buy it for some fun i love the ramones and I am sure they would probably love it too although johnny would probably grumble about some of the arrangements

this tribute had quite a few metal bands on there which as a normal human also known as metalhead i would ponder why they would use such good bands to cover such a sh tty new york garbage band i love rob zombie but no one can make it sound rite the ramones are an overrated untalented band kinda like the acdc of punk so f ck the ramones cannibal corpse owns

i think this tribute should of had more punk bands doing the songs it is a pretty lame line-up if you ask me i do like metallica and u2 but they do not do the ramones the way they needed to be done in my opinion the line-up sucks but there are some good songs

this should have been and so easily could have been a great album as it turned out only four of the seventeen artists metallica kiss peter yorn and garbage play any inspired tributes to the ramones that would be enjoyable to their fans most of the tracks are such ludicrous reinterpretations that their departures from the source material approximate the tongue-in-cheek satire of mefirst and the give me gimmes or the flying lizards but without the loving respect or creativity of these cover bands this is closer to the golden throats compilation where we hear william shatner singing mr tambourine man a one-listen curiosity and a bore

buy it and do not wait for anyone to pat you on the back for buying it either you will understand or you will not from reading other reviews I am convinced that the slack-jawed punky brewsters of the current generation have no clue too much television i think why you must own a copy forward written by stephen king the strange and unusual eddie vedder singing a song of positivity quote of the compilation if people were not such [ ] cover art have a little respect and cut the rock-n-roll high school crap unless it was mr zombies

the only good cover is made by rancid because is the only real punk rock group on this album the offsprings and green days songs are a copy not a cover they does not put their own style so they sucks i think that thecover is very good too

there have been several ramones tribute albums but this is the first one to feature big name acts the results are varied of course like on any tribute album the young pop punk acts green day rancid and the offspring perform good faithful versions of the songs most of the other acts try to put their own spin on the songs the most interesting variations are to me by red hot chili peppers garbage the pretenders tom waits grammy nominated for his song on this album and john frusciante unlisted bonus track most of the songs are at least decent except for marilyn mansons dirge-like version of the kkk took my baby away which is god-awful this cd should be of interest to ramones fans who do not mind hearing their heroes songs played in different styles

bought this on a whim it is a true tribute to how many artist site this simple and unique band from queens new york as a influence the tracks range from intriguingly different rh chilipeppers rob zombie and tom waits to unchangingly consistant u2 garbage green day and offspring to just downright silly and uninspired no better example than m mansons the kkk took my baby away one of my personal favorite ramone tunes if you find this used for around 6 or under like i did it is worth it otherwise there are better ways to spend your time and money i guess that is why there are about 53 used copies for sale here especially if you do not have the original ramones recordings of these cuts classics just one more thing thank you ramones for saving rock n roll
good cd my favorite songs are i just want to have someting to do garbage outsider green day and sheena is a punk rocker rancid

i only liked three songs on this cd tracks 11 - 13 come on people when the offspring have one of the best songs on the cd you know something is wrong you know joey and dee dee must be rolling over in there graves first this and then marky and the other guy sell the rights for blizkrieg bop to a cell phone company this is a cd for kids that buy a ramones shirt from hot topic and think there punk would like do not waste your money on this

the way this tribute was put together was simply amazing rob zombie seemed to know what song fitted with the bands style like havana affair the way the red hot chili peppers did it was amazing and marylin manson singing the kkk took my baby away was eerie and just bad ass the craziest thing about it is i hate the ramones i admit that there is some songs of theirs i like but not a whole lot they do not even have talent but to sum it all up this cd is amazing

overpaid dull mtv approved rock stars covering a real rock n roll band that followed a path none of these corporate ding dongs have the guts to follow none of these bands deserve to be on this tribute except tom waits who is the only talented songwriter on this hunk of junk where has motorhead where has antiseen this is for dorky lawyers who read rolling stone and drive pt cruisers this is a tribute album of a rock n roll band by products that could not rock their way out of a paper bag except tom waits what has the point of this no mainstream crud cared about the ramones or dee and joey until they died which happens all the time no one cares about tom waits or rambles on about his incredible albums but wait until he has dead they did not care about joey working with the misfits which jerry only and doyle are no where to be found on this cd and do not even exist to alot of people somewhere some kid is sniffing glue and getting in a fight with his mom slamming his door and throwing on rocket to russia that is a more fitting tribute to the ramones than this hunk of crummy stuff

the covers on the album from punk bands like rancid are ok but are total [ junk]next to the real thing are not all tribute songs on the other hand there has mansons version of the kkk took my baby away that [ smelled ] a lot rob zombies blitzkreg bop would be good if they played faster because the ramones were known to be loud and fast so the songs that were slowed down [ were bad ] do not buy this because it is not worth it

i know that rob zombie had the best of intentions in releasing this record i really do this fact does not save this record from being an utter trashpile with few memorable moments the kiss and rob zombie covers surge well enough but overall this record is a tired retread by bands paying tribute to a band who probably would have loathed them had they been in the same era and league skip it

i have almost every ramones disc available i formed a band in high school after discovering rocket to russia the ramones made me believe in the divine healing power of the power chord so naturally i snapped this up first week fortunately this disc does not make like a carpet cleaner set on shag it does however help us understand what made the ramones so special there is not a single song on we are a happy family that makes me want to forget the original in fact some of the acts here make such inconsequentially redundant versions that they sound like ramones cover bands

i saw this on a listening station at a cd store and thought I had give it a shot I shall premise this by saying that i am a huge rob zombie fan but zombies version of blitzkrieg bop has got to be one of the worst things i have ever heard in my life i mean it was simply terrible then bono trying to pull off beat on the brat was simply embarrassing metallica yeah ok all in all i could not find too much to salvage on this album rancid is good i did not listen to the offspring track so maybe that ones ok but the rest is terrible so why buy a whole cd for one or two good tracks a proper tribute would have at least had x iggy pop jello biafra henry rollins social distortion bad religion bad brains frank black and many other people who actually wrote music that either inspired or was inspired by the ramones

from stephen kings stoopid embarrassing liner notes and that is not stoopid embarrassing in a good way to bono mincing his way through beat on the brat this package is stunningly misguided kiss comes off the best which should tell you all that you need to know this is the ramones as product which goes against everything they were about one two three four chuck the thing out the door

you can not listen to a tribute cd the same way you would a normal album you can not expect the songs to sound anything like the originals the entitre point of a tribute cd is for other artists to put a twist on the original song if you listen to this cd for what is it a tribute album you will be happy if you expect to hear the ramones when you listen to this album no you will not be happy this album has great intentions with the proceeds benifiting the lymphoma reseach foundation it is a win win situation with this album a great album to have around

most of this is a joke seriously metallica sound like a bunch of old men rob zombie creates a disco version of blitzkrieg bop mansons version is a predictable slow and creepy take the offsprings inclusions shows how out of touch rob zombie is kiss eddie vedder and zeke rancid and tom waits are basically the only versions worth checking out rooney gee thanks weezer skip this and buy the ramones tribute on white jazz records that features the hellacopters sahara hotnights jesse malin gluecifer and more

this is by far the worst cd that i have ever heard if you like the ramones at all you would want to hurt almost every band on this cd with the exception of rancid and the offspring very badly the other bands on this cd murdered anything that ever was good of the ramones i have no respect for any of those bands marilyn manson ruined a great song u2 did the same if there was the option of giving 0 stars i would even negative this is not a tribute disc this is torture to the ramones the ramones fans and anything that is ever was and ever will be punk this is a tragedy

the ramones what can be said this band revolutionized rock and roll if not for these guys where would we be today with todays mainstream dominated by pop-punk acts like blink 182 and good charlotte this album in addition to being a big old thank you to the american punk rock band from 16 great acts is also a reminder that there was once good music 17 new twists on classic ramones songs played by a wide aray of rock bands like green day kiss garbage red hot chili peppers the pretenders pete yorn and marilyn manson how could a ramones fan not want this album i most definately recommend buying it by the way do not stop listening after eddie vedder and zekes rendition of daytime dilemma there has a hidden track by the chili peppers john frusciante to finish off this interenting and diverse tribute to a great band

he completly messed up blitzkrieg bop but most of the cd is pretty good although the original was better i must comment on offsprings version of i want to be sedated they did an awesome job although they should have had bad religion doing one of the songs

i recieved this cd for valentines day from my girlfriend she knows i love the ramones when i first looked at the cd and examined the track listing my heart sunk i love the song blitzkreig bop but would i like rob zombies version but after listening to the whole cd my opinion changed this cd pays tribute to the greatest punk band of all time except for a few misses marilyn manson and pete yorn the cd is pure gold i would defnitly recomend this to anyone who likes the ramones

i have to start by saying i do not know anything about the ramones i bought this cd because i am a die hard kiss fan boy was i surprised the sheer talent of the bands on this cd alone is worth the price kiss u2 metallica eddie vedder rancid offspring to name just a few and the songs they played rock marilyn mansons might be the lamest song of the set and even it is not so bad the best probably belongs to kiss version of rock and roll radio this has made me want to get the ramones original recordings whether you like the ramones the bands on this tribute or just good rock this cd is definitely worth owning

overall a good tribute cd most of the songs capture the essence of the original one of the most pleasing surprises wastrack which seems to stick pretty close to the original the biggest disappointment was marilyn manson taking a great song and just simply destroying it rob zombies effort was also dissapointing still worth picking up

this tribute solidifies what many fans of the ramones have known for years the only people who should play ramones songs are the ramones i am sure that the participants of this tribute with the blessing of johnny and under his supervision mean well enough the problem is that on the surface those who chose to alter the arrangments to put their own stamp on these songs have missed the mark trying to be different and those who remained faithful to the bands original version can not do them justice true fans will want this album to support the band and the legacy they left behind but it will not be something they will listen to more than a few times fans of those artists participating and casual ramones fans will be greatly disappointed there are too many missteps here to go track by track to discuss but the novelty of this tribute is that it will be perceived as just a novelty leave the ramones songs to the ramones

all in all this is a good cd the best tracks are red hot chili peppers rob zombie manson metallica metallica recorde 53rd and 3rd just like the ramones but the other three took good songs and put their own flavor on it the rest of the songs were too slow are too fast the ramones had it just right so why mess with it

great tribute album only weak spots are the mansons track and waits track still good but the rest are incredible rooney does not even have a big label release yet and they do an incredible version of here today gone tomorrow personal favorite is garbages i just want to have something to do i highly recommend it for fans of the bands and fans of the ramones alike

hey mick and keith open your vaults and release some real rarities almost all of this is available from previous releases come on guys we know you have enough in the can to fill twenty 30 gig ipods let us be more adventuresome go with the dylan formula of releasing boxes and boxes of bootlegs they will sell do not worry

well i agree with most reviewers most of this stuff is readly available there three solid gems the live let it rock being one of them so yes i will buy this but really this was a shoddy attempt at xmas buyers i mean where are all the b-sides like so young I am gon na drive jump on top of me those three songs alone would be worth it they should have put those on voodoo lounge come on mick and co give us a proper rarities and b-sides cd

this is a very stupid compilation with two essentials and a few tidbits the 1971 live version of let it rock is fabulous and the 1974 b-side through the lonely nights features some great mick taylor guitar playing i always liked the steel wheels b-side fancy man blues but do we really need live versions of thru and thru mannish boy rare it is the version from love you live tumblingand wild horses rare it is the same version from stripped i wanted two of these cuts so i bought this cd hence a two star rating but the idiots who complied this cd were lazy and stupid in their selections
great cd exactly what i was looking for thank you
some neat songs I had never heard by them gift for my husband which he loves he listens to it constantly
it is a great album i enjoy listening to the rolling stones all of their albums are great been to a few concerts
i am enjoying this cd different or unreleased tracks some b-sides released only in 45rpm vinyls very hard to obtain

I am a woodstock era lady who has all the rolling stones best rock and roll band in the world bar none i think this is a most under-rated album i can not believe some of the reviews it is so freaking well done every song is live to me I am not a musician so i do not look at it from that way it makes my soul rejoice every time i hear it if you are a rolling stones fan this must be allowed into your collection and if you have not heard it give it 1 try pick any song i rate it among the best work they have done
despite the absence to a large extent of genuine rarities this album was my only way of getting access to let it rock
the songs included on this album are available elswhere i wanted the version of miss you and wild horses in one spot so i bought it

this compilation does compile many key stones rarities from the sucking in the 70s vinyl album and newer sources that are not currently available anywhere else to me the classic if i was a dancer dance part 2 is worth the price of admission alonce the stones need to keep this going and release some of the many unreleased some girls sessions tracks the miss you cassette version and the 12 inch versions of under cover of the night while i can not splain the miss you edit on this album i can not say that it is inferior to the longer original 12 inch version which is avaiable by the way on the do not stop cd single that promoted the 40 licks compliation from 2002 bottom line is that i can not imagime why a stones fan would not like this album despite the songs that are not here and the stupid and lazy mistakes in the liner notes

even someone like myself who does not own every stones album ever made can tell these are not all that rare but i like it and it has grown to be my favorite road cd as i work i like the fact that it is not a greatest hits collection but a mixture so do not buy it thinking it is like the beatles anthology but more like you burned a cd randomly choosing some stones songs and you will be happy with it

early in 2005 there were a few stones releases on the schedule that never saw the light of day stones freaks like myself salivated over the prospect of hearing these multi-disc collections which promised outtakes and unreleased recordings and live songs from the late 1960s and early 1970s instead we got this knock-off christmas release that amounted to nothing more than theft i bought rarities as soon as it came out for full price i had already bought sucking in the seventies given the crossover of tracks i soon felt like a total sucker as for airbrushing out bill wyman this reminds me of the recent double-disc compilation which featured a thick booklet but no space for mick taylor i love the stones but i hate how they rip off their fans and what has with the stalin-like rewriting of history

well it seems that neither abkco or virgin know the history of the band hey hey hey that is what i say will someone please hire a person who actually knows the recording history of the band the monkees have a better cd collection than the rolling stones and that is pretty sad the monkees were not even a real group stop issuing the same songs and versions if you house this stuff for too long pretty soon no one will care we will all be too old as the song says i am waiting

there were only a handful of rolling stones songs that managed to make their way into the 12 era of the late 70s and 80s and while they are basically all on this mish-mosh of rareties there has only one full length 12 mixed emotions is it is full 610 12 version as other reviewers have stated miss you loses a minute but also the new york mix of harlem shuffle has been edited down by about 40 seconds not to mention the original vinyl 12 version of the song had two different mixes the flip side being a uk 12 mix it would have been like striking gold to find that on here too instead of all these live tracks who cares as well as the full length 12 versions of the other tracks otherwise why bother putting the stuff onto cd at last probably the only time any attempt will ever be made to preserve these remix rareties
