rarities 1971 - 2003 the rolling stones is a really nice compilation of rare tracks from one of the best bands in rock and roll history jagger is a stupendous vocalist and the lyrics are better then what most rock artist can put to paper i am not a huge blues fan myself but and the early tracks sound a bit too much like blues then again the stones can make even blues sound good and to me that is not an easy feat there are so many good tracks on this collection like the awesome live version of beast of burden the dance version of miss you and many others the book-let is very nice and the photos are of a remarkable quality i highly recommmend this amazing compilation of rare tracks both to stones fans and fans of good music in general

just a quick note-chris bushmans reviews are always welcome-i use them to help decide song running order and which cds get burned with extra tracks from the tunes contained on other cds from the same session such as tops and waiting on a friend from tatoo you get re-burned onto a cd with the rest of the goats head soup album to make it a more complete listening experience anyway the live version of live with me on this cd is the same version that appeared on the wild horses single so it seems that this is from the same sessions as yeilded the stripped live album the other 3 tracks on that cd single are all from the stripped live dates so I am not sure that this really is the same version that was contained as a b-side to a voodoo lounge era single
let us rock a good lick of the stones and their history some great material can be heard on this one get it and enjoy it
i like maybe two songs from the stones i do not get their popularity i wanted to rate it 0 stars sorry

first they release bigger bang in a deluxe edition a greedy insult to fans if ever there was one now this complete thieves ridiculous ticket prices a ridiculous number of greatest hits and live albums now this insulting sloppily scraped together rarities collection no conscience shameful absolutely shameful

is anyone truly surprised that the stones would release a piece of dung such as this they have been doing it for years look at flowers for petes sake the rolling stones have plenty of rabid fans who would gladly empty their pockets for a bootleg box set ala dylan so if greed is their motivation at this point please fellows exercise some quality control

if you love the rolling stones you will be glad you got this it is full of good quality out-takes such as fancy man blues anyway you look at it wish I had never met you through the lonely nights let it rock and the full length miss you enjoy note pick up the new deep purple disc rapture of the deep check amazon reviews as the virgin mega-store ad puts it unmissable i love those old british rockers
something stink on this collection of rarities bill wyman was missing unjustly of the credits and cover mick and keith are a really old bastards of rock n roll shame shame shame

these are not exactly rarities i mean wild horses from stripped exactly how is that a rarity maybe if your car will not start and you can not get to best buy but that proviso aside it is a fun collection that does not flag for a second

this album is a disgrace the stones are obviously trying to fill some contractual obligation it was also a contractual obligation that led the stones to record and release the rarity co sucker blues which ironically is left off this album by the way bill wyman has been airbrushed out of the picture used for the albums cover that is loyalty for you save the cash that you plan to spend on this album and give it to a hurricane katrina charity

here we are in stones 101 look the person that picked these songs gets it thank god sure you have these songs on other discs or records so what listen to the music the stones are playing music they love blues american blues and rhythm and blues listen to little red rooster on the early rolling stones now if that does not knock you flat no hope the stones love willie dixon howling wolf chuck berry muddy waters i could go on but i will not american blues this disc is great and i wish for more this disc blows away this lastest crapola disc that is out i wish the stones would put out a pure blues album like clapton did i wish satisfaction had not become the hit it did in the long run it ruined the stones

I am a huge stones fan like alot of you i bought this because of the taylor era songs ttln is an awesome song i could not believe when i saw that this great song was going to be released an remastered i have this on a old 45 and a few bootleg cds but the sound quality is not there too many pops and more any taylor era stones releases are gems when are they going to release all of those gems he made with the stones the taylor / stones years were the best most stones fans will agree from 1969 - 1975 where have you gone mick taylor we miss your guitar playing cheers

the stones or their record company need some counseling do they want to issue true rarities here are some suggestions think I am going mad claudine emotional rescue outtake drift away criss-cross man goat 's outtake living in a harder love fiji gin some girls outtake yellow cab lonely at the top stones version not solo jagger travellin man exile outtake the list goes on and on when are they going to open the vaults to call this collection rarities is an insult for abkco some suggestions too that could make us stones fans very happy looking tired satisfaction early version with harp blood red and wine co k sucker blues gold painted nails highway child extraordinary let it bleed outtake jumpin jack flash tv version record companies should invest a little time do research and deliver true lost gems

fancy man blues the original b-side to mixed emotions sounds like an outtake from exile on main st which is probably the ultimate compliment you can give a single but the rest eeeeehhhhhhh i can not conceive of the quantity of narcotics it would be necessary to ingest to listen to miss you for much more than a minute the timing of bigger bang coupled with the timing of the release of this cd much like the release of metamorphosis in tandem with whatever-that-early-seventies greatest hits thing back in 1975 made in the shade just proves that it has all already been done i mean come on guys take the hint that stus death and bills defection should have given you and retire gracefully please do not pull a kurt cobain and have charlie die onstage just to get attention

the reviewers here except for scott holter are 1 thinkin too much and not listening enough and 2 collectors who already have most of the cuts so ok but for the rest of the planet if you love the stones and mostly just have the best mastered copies you could get of the albums on vinyl and/or cd and even mayhaps a boot or two this will be a killer addition to your merely human collection the sound quality is primo for 16 bit and the cuts are incredible a delicious mix that was obviously pleasing to the ole boys themselves i was literally shouting out joyously in response to blastin thru this stuff this is great great great thank you rolling stones for this and the new album now give me more

this is a missed opportunity with the exception of the previously unreleased live version of tumblingand two previously vinyl-only tracks let it rock and through the lonely nights there is nothing else on this cd that is remotely rarejust a re-hash of tracks from flashpoint collectibles sucking in the 70s love you live stripped another side of steel wheels and several uk cd singles a major letdown since there are still many vinyl-only stones tracks from the past 35 years such a lazy compiling effort

what a rip off i love the stones but i can not believe they have the balls to call tracks from love you live no security stripped and sucking in the 70s rarities of course the back cover does not tell you the source and year of the recordings you get to find out when you get open it up like i did

i love the stones but there are too many of the same songs on many of their albums why do not they just come out with a true b-side collection instead of this sad excuse for a rarities when i looked at the track listing it was pathetic do you really need a remixed version of miss you they could have done better

i am a huge fan of korn and i have faithfully bought each album / dvd / singlewhen they were released however this to me is only worth getting if you enjoy hearing live recordings I have heard boot-legs and I have seen boot-legs videos and although they are sort of cool to have or to see at a friends they all lack in quality be it performance or sound quality this cd has some of the very best live recordings I have heard from korn if you really like korn and want to hear some really tight performances of some of their songs pick this up also keep an eye out for their upcoming live from the other side dvd shot in hi-def from the current tour

i was not a really big korn fan their music is kool thou from their first album to the present iv seen them twice they are bad ass and identification like to continue to se them when the come to my town this cd is awsome it is like seeing them in concert over and over just listening to them jam

being a diehard korn fan my review might be a little biased but this cd was great it made me even more excited to go to there show in august the only thing that i was unhappy with was the names jonathon davis called the audience but at 29 i may just be too old to understand that or really appreciate it
mainly taken from the cbgbs free gig great live sound not too many rarities unfortunately

the following can be said about this album rare all of you who are contemplating the purchase of this album should look the other way chances are you already have all of these songs except maybe proud a final thought would be this rare does not even describe the album cover turn it 90 degrees counterclock-wise ever seen george romeros land of the dead

what is there to be said about this album apart from what your already thinking why why did live and rare make it to be a korn album tell me and I shall show you a green dog they should have put in remixes to all the song that were not even rare this is good music tho just get a beter record label korn

pick this disc up on this album you get some great live tracks from the cbgbs preformance best of all you get my gift to you live from woodstock 99 this is a fantastic song live and it is worth getting the cd just for this song who cares if you have heard half of these tracks before support korn

so this is what happens when your former record label wants to cash in on your popularity even after you have left have to say that this disc while not bad still leaves a lot to be desired it is a very underwhelming first listening and while it does grow on you it is not a disc that you are dying to listen to again for me the three-part another brick in the wall is great but does not hold up to repeated plays that being said the bands performance of one is a nice addition just wish they did a more complete version of the song my biggest complaint about the disc is the mix overall the performance at cbgbs in new york city is a poor live recording folks the vocals are way down in the mix and the bass is all over the place virtually on top of everything else no excuse with the recording technology available these days nice try epic but this one just ultimately falls flat

first off you have to understand that korn does not as a group endorse this release nor did they choose what material would be on this live and rare album you see upon leaving epic / immortal for the virgin label korn lost all rights to everything they recorded / produced under sonys label therefore sony now has all control and can release junky compilations like this whenever / however they want now the songs are excellent do not take this review as me bashing korn i am criticizing sony for releasing these readily available tunes for a quick buck nothing is rare about this album i can not wait for the day sony has to sell off the korn catalouge hopefully korn and virgin will be ready to deal the highest bid

not going to buy this one a korn live cd would have been cool by itself a korn rare tracks cd would have been even better but why the hail would they include one of the few rare songs proud on this i mean hail you make a live or you make a rare or even better you make both not this poorly put together compilation but a double disk one live cd and the rare tracks one the live stuff on this looks fine but you need the other rare cd with camel song i can not remember sean olson jingle balls kick the pa and any other locked-up slop that is rotting in the vaults i know i know there are money issues involved just release them separately and rake in more cash
like pretty much everybody has said already buy it for the live stuff rare eh not so much the live tracks will keep ya happy although 999 well spent

this album should not have been made not because of the music but because it was put out by korns former label epic obviously trying to get paid as korn promotes see you on the other side this is a suits album plain and simple as of the release date may 9 2006 korn has not even mentioned it on their website on to the album itself there is nothing rare here it is basically their greatest hits live many korn fans might even have tracks that are on this album the live version of metallicas one is here the same hidden track on take a look in the mirror however that does not make it bad it is fun to listen to and it is always a bonus when you can hear the crowd singing along especially the chorus but still this should not have been made at all had jonathan davis been involved I am sure it would have been better

yeah i agree with the last comment there has nothing rare about this album proud from the movie i know what you did last summer earach my eye frollow leader bonus track another brick n the wall gre hits one take a look n the mirror however it is damn good live album good quality sound great for subs n your car it is the same recording from the bonus dvd that you get when you buy take a look n the mirror for those did not realize that so if your die hard fan i suggest you get it add to your collection new to korn even better actually it is like a greatest hits but live pretty much so buy peeps

this is a pretty good collection of live korn songs but there is not really any rare tracks proud is probably the only one on here that is rare earache my eye is not really a rare track to me if it is a bonus song on follow the leader than you can not really call it rare i do wish the had camel song it comes on the end of days soundtrack should of been more rare tracks but what you going to do the live tracks are good right now and one are my favorite tracks good live songs but only get it if your a die hard korn fan it is not really for everyone and if yoy really want to save some money most of the songs on here you can find to download it seems epic just tried to make some money off korn

i am in total agreement with lounge sound from fl this is absolutely positively the worst hotel costes volume to date boring repetitive almost put me to sleep i was completely underwhelmed at the first listen but decided to give it another try last night and was even more disappointed the second time around there simply are not any stand-out tracks on this one each song sounds like the next the other hotel costes cds might be hit or miss but there are at least a minimum of 2 - 3 solid tracks on each costes 10 has nothing to offer save your and pass on this one

i can understand how fans of the hotel costes series always expect incredible music and i will not deny that the first time i listened to hc x i was a bit underwhelmed however after listening to the cd 4 times i am starting to see the genius of stephane behind the musical selection give it a try you will not be disappointed

i really expected a lot more from stephane this is his worst cd to date most of the tracks on this cd are repetitious in sound tone and beat boring this is definitely nothing to write home about i was hoping to discover some new artists but all this cd did was to help me despise previous artists that i loved case in point louie austen his song glamour girl was so painful to listen to that i skipped the track i just could not take it dephazz was mediocre at best and zimpala stephane picked their worst song as well what happened

looks like stephane pompougnac and the gang are back in the groove with this five star collection of gorgeous music i was a little disappointed with costes 8 and 9 was so much better but it looks like number 10 will put costes firmly back on the map as one of coolest and tastiest collections for your home or open air driving enjoyment the whole is only as good as the sum of the parts and this cd has a dreamlike quality that takes costes in some new and pleasurable directions where do these guys find these little gems i will not get into individual tracks here yet but needless to say this cd is sonic ear candy at it is finest bravo nobody does this stuff better than pompougnac

i have to agree with other reviews that are negative this is not the best of stephane and I am very surprised by it can not say i would tell someone that they should purchase it not good compared to the earlier cds

i own all previous 9 costes cds and was unsure whether to buy this cd after reading negative reviews yes it is different from the other costes but you would not buy 10 cds that sound the same the costes sound has evolved and this is another fine selection from pompougnac i suggest you listen to it without bias and open your ears it really grows on you favourites would have to be glamour girl and fleur blanche

the first 5 6 were great albums especially 4 but this one by far is the worst album created by stephane even worse that living on thei went ahead and both this at virgin just because i collect the series and i am sure a lot of people here also did as well but trust me do not buy this one and use it as a chance to look at other artists

i am a fan of this series and own them all in my opinion this is just the best of course closely followed by 8 and 3 if you like the songs with a little more beat this is a great pic i got it 6 months ago when it was released and still listen to it every morning as my alarm clock

i have been so pleased with all of the hotel costes series that when i went to paris i stayed at the hotel for the experience and the lounge it truly is an expensive hotel the lounge is about the size of my living room there were never people there i do not know what i was expecting but the hotel did not deliver the musical experience nor did it have stephane it is close to the eiffel tower i wanted to go to the buddha bar but was told to go first to the cantine du faubourg disappointment the mezzanine was fabulous the music the atmosphere the experience as far as stephane i have purchased all of his music and will continue to the next time i go to paris i will have to think twice about staying at a trendy hotel with no lounge it is recognition here in the us is because of his music
this one is one of my top four favorite hotel costes you will not be dissappointed
I have been a fan os the costes seroes since day one and while the series has had it isand downs this release represents a new low was stephane sleep-walking his way through this collection

i have all the hotel costes cds and i loved this one in fact i think 10 is the best since 5 and 6 although 9 was pretty good as well apparently there is quite a divergence of opinion when it comes to rating the cds in this series my advice is to sample the tracks and judge for yourself
another great release for the series interesting quirky with plenty of variety spinning it a lot these days

i have been collecting all of this series and i have to say that this is the best one yet in my opinion well worth the listen even if you are not a hotel costes listener it is very good background music for home work or your favorite cafe sean
i have all 10 and they just get better every year great job stephane
another great cd by the master himself start off a bid slow once you get pass the first two tracks the cd comes a live
this is the worst hotel costes what a disappointment the music is boring and unexciting maybe that is why they will not give out samples to listen
i was very disappointed after listening to the spectacular 7 8 and 9 disks it is different and it is not horrible but what a bummer

very chill hangout music soft beats and awesome sounding tracks like nothing really out there perfect beach summer beach music i would def recommend if you are looking for something chill to listen to on your mp3 player or in the living room when friends are hanging out first time around it is good and it gets better each time you listen to it

looking at the previous reviews it just shows that in the end it all comes down to personal taste i have the entire series to date and yes i think some are better than others but all have something interesting and enjoyable to offer often it takes a little time i do not think these cds can be judged on the first couple of hearings true i do not think this is the best but it is still very a good compilation and the albums covers just keep getting better

i have to agree this is the worst in the series the series has been getting progressivly worse since vol 5 but this set is awful the first 3 cuts sound the same and seem out of place with following lounge / chill tracks the offerings from zimpala dephazz and afterlife are their weakest and the less said the better about louie austens vocals the only decent track sunday drive is already available on stephanes hello mademoiselle release perhaps it is time to end the series because there are much better lounge and chill available

i loved the first cd so i was so excited to buy this one after waiting for a long time i was really let down i listened to the whole cd with a sinking feeling where is the screamo where is the punk rock all i heard here was daughtry nickelback wannabes some of the lyrics where heartfelt but most of it was shallow and just like everything else you have heard before in fact the whole cd feels as if you have heard it before and better elsewhere this is frankly boring and very mediocre rja you guys go back to your punk-screamo roots forget mainstreaming yourselves because in doing that you have alienated the fans who really loved you

after the success if headlining tours and the platinum do not you fake it i was certainly expecting great things from rja their first single was not too impressive taking the sound I had come to love from the band and turning it on it is head however pen and paper the second song from the album I had heard restored my faith regardless I had be picking it up as rja has always been on the top of my list of bands along with 30 seconds to mars and monty are i however lonely road was too different i did not recognize one of my favorite bands the guitar melodies were often repetitious and without knowing exactly what happened with elias i start wondering if the sound was so dramatically different because of his departure ronnie pumps up the vocals this time around hitting notes that send chills of joy down your spine but the music behind the voice did not progress the new sound why the new sound anyway platinum records mean nothing is broken so do not fix it it sounds like they wanted to move forward musically they just too big of ainto a sound i neither recognize nor enjoy

first off I have been really excited about the second album since i finished listening to the first album so i ran out to target the morning of it is release dropped 10 bucks and ran to my car i tore the packaging and almost broke the case anxious to hear it sadly there is nothing blistering about this album i try to stay out of bands personal issues but i would say either the absence of elias or the new producer regardless of his success with daughtry severely maimed the signature rja-sound i kid you not as soon as i finished the last track which i found myself checking how much was left a mere two minutes into i fired up do not you fake it and jammed out why 2 stars well I am loyal to my boys and the quality is there all the songs are done well nothing sloppy but now I am listening to cat and mouse and it kicks the piss out of the new album the sheer raw bad-assedness matched to the raw emotional crossover of the first album is in no way represented by the new album
i agree it is not as goot as the last cd but it is still good they rock

mainly this is in comment and response to the previous review you think that they are going to mainstream with softer drum beats you apparently did not listen to some of the songs on this album a good mix of hardcore and more mainstream alternative although not quite as good as their original hit album i give it 45 stars

unfortunately this is nothing like their first cd the lyrics are weak and uninspiring the music lacks anyor ingenuity even worse the vocals and the music seem to be forced together and create an unnatural rhythm that is just hard to listen to there is not a single song on the album that i could force myself to like i am not sure why they went the way they did but if you are looking for more of what you saw on do not you fake it you will be disappointed i will hold out hope that their next attempt gets back to where they started

if you are a red jumpsuit apparatus fan and enjoy their previous album then do not buy this album their first album is an all-time favorite of mine for the intensity the good heavy guitar sound and a perfect balance of screaming and singing this album has zero screaming a poppy fluff guitar sound and boring soft drum beats grossss they are just trying now to be radio friendly instead of the hardcore band they once were 0 stars from me

it is not easy making a successful second album after a great first one but rja did it the first track is smoking harder rock with great vocals so many good songs and several that really get stuck in your head there are one or two softer ballad songs too-a nice mix i am just crazy about this album there is not a song i do not like on it

this cd is great my fifteen-year-old daughter loves this cd she said this cd of the red jumpsuit apparatus is better than their first cd do not you fake it it is more enjoyable because there has no screaming on it so you can actually hear what ronnie thesinger is singing about all the lyrics were beautifully written especially godspeed

i was expecting more of the same from rja the second set was much more commercial poppy even it still had some really good songs but not of the same caliber as the do not you fake it set I am not dissappointed although because the more i listen the more i like it good job but not great first album gets that 5th star

i loved the first album especially justify and grim goodbye the screaming gave it some intensity this new album has a few good tunes but they get annoying overall this album sucks do not buy it better off with the jonas brothers or some crap like that make a better album guys i know u have it in you that is grim goodbye awesome

granted this is different from do not you fake it but the thing is you can not make the same album over and over again i think this is a solid and honest effort it is a great album like i said it is different for trja but it is different in a good way a new direction and i like where they are headed

i was a fan of do not you fake it but i did not think it was the end all be all to music like some reviewers on here this album is very different than their first one and to be honest when i first gave it a listen it did not do much for me at all i found the music to be quite weak yet i found his vocals to be enthralling no he does not scream which personally i find refreshing but i think they are even more passionate than on their first one i try not to judge an album until I have listened to it at least three times through and boy am i glad i stuck with this not every song is gold but more so than not i think if you just try and listen to this on it is own terms and not as the follow-up to do not fake it then it just might grow on you not near as bad as the others reviews on here imply

do not you fake it is my favorite record possibly ever i could not wait for the next record i can not explain how disappointed i was the music on the first record was outrageous ronnies vocals were great but the music alone was fantastic to listen to jons drums were incredible dukes and elias guitars were amazing the louder the better what happened if i did not recognize ronnies voice i would never have guessed it was rja it is a good record but absolutely nothing like the first it is totally mellow compared to the first record that totally rocked i kept waiting for a song that i wanted to turn up the volume for but it never came if there is a third record which i wonder if there will be since i doubt this one will do well i hope they go back and find their true voice

where has the emotion the passion for the music like on do not you fake it is mia overall my first impression is did somebody let ronnie winter do the vocals on the new hanson cd the first album instantly drew me in ronnies passion for the lyrics he was singing amazing then this album brings the same happy tone over and over again reminds me of a bad christian alternative band i look forward to the next album let us try to make original rja fans enjoy your music again stop the charade in what seems like an attempt to draw in teeny bopper fans do not you fake it will stay one of my favorites but this one does not even come close sorry guys
volume 1 was much better owing largely to better selection of songs these tunes on volume 2 are not as conducive to sweet / hoffs cover treatment just too many popular songs in my opinion

i just recd this cd in todays mail and am listening to it now it really does bring back alot of good high school and college memories i listened to these songs and artists and saw alot of them in concert the dead the raspberries fleetwood mac clapton bowie carly tom petty yes todd rundgren linda ronstadt john lennon george harrison bread and rod stewart this is another good effort by matthew sweet and susanna hoffs fairly faithful cover versions of songs you have heard many times before by the original artists but somehow they manage to put their own spin on them

pretty much these covers nail the original but sweet and hoffs bring an affection to their tributes that comes across in the music the band the playing the vocals are all perfectly executed without trying to be too cute about it i think i like the version of yes I have seen all good people / your move presented here better than the original it is that good you can find instances of some of these songs on youtube tell me how a 53-year-old susanna hoffs can look like a foxy 30-year-old she looks amazing and sings better than ever I have gone back and looked for under the covers volume 1 as a result of hearing volume 2 brilliant stuff sweets pop sensibilities are sharply attuned to reviving some pretty cool stuff recommend both of these covers albums highly

once upon a time matthew sweet created fantastic often beautiful songs apparently having grown bored with this he decided to focus his considerable talents on creating covers with ex-bangle susanna hoffs track after track I am amazed at the lack of imagination this duo has put into their covers album series note to the artists if you want to do good covers choose poor songs and reimagine them into something better do not cover tom petty and then sing like tom petty do not cover classic yes what were you thinking there is just nothing to get excited about here although I am really looking forward to their 80s cover album which reportedly will include covers of relax who can it be now and i ran so far away

i do not get this i have enormous respect for matthew sweet and susanna hoffs on their own but this work makes no sense these are not interpretations of songs they are duplications / impersonations of songs what are these two reknowned artists now wedding band singers i especially do not understand hoffs since her cover of steeler wheels stuck in the middle of you and lulus to sir with love is nothing short of phenomenal she can do so much better to any of you that would be a proponent of this why not just listen to the original since what is the point

sweet jesus i love this collection sue and matt or susie and sid are such fans and the love comes through hearing their voices blend on the yes song I have seen all good people is close to bliss and we get the channeling of lost souls like alex chilton back of a car and george harrison beware of darkness with great reverence for the original i was fortunate enough to see susanna sing linda ronstadt in a lunchtime honky tonk in nashville in 1984 so willin is a special treat since vol 1 were 60s songs and vol 2 covers the 70s we can only hope that vol 3 see you next time will take on the 1980s maybe matthew sweet will try the bangles dover beach

quite simply a beautiful rendering of these great songs they have done it again and i can not stop listening to it their voices are such a perfect blend that it would make the beatles blush and they render the beatles as well if not better i can not wait to hear what they do next more tours puleeeeeeeesssss buy this album you will love it

i totally agree with several fan reviews posted here that vol i of this collaboration which focused on some very interesting song choices from the 1960s was excellent but their move into the 70s falls flat unlike another reviewer here who thought this album looked great on paper but was disappointed when he heard it i did not good god who would want to hear this very sweet-sounding harmony duo cover unique un-topable songs like all the young dudes and bell bottom blues not me but i gave it a try and was right most of these cover versions do not work the only song i really like is back of the car and maybe that is because i am not familiar with the original by big star their attempts at country rock fare little better buy volume 1 and maybe they will have better luck if they move on to the 1980s also buy the thorns album on which mathew sweet works with a couple of other male singers on a fine album of original crosby stills and nash-style songs

i enjoyed volume 1 by these talented musicians and bought this one hoping for a little more interpretation of the tunes unfortunately they stayed so close to the originals that it just is not very interesting to listen to repeatedly both of them could easily add some additional harmonies or arrangements or even guitar or keyboard solos to add some spice to the tunes i hope they are willing to experiment more if they try thisagain I shall certainly be more cautious about my next purchase meanwhile I am going back to original versions

if you liked vol 1 you will also like this one i am a geat van but was skeptical when i heard they were covering yes but they bdo a great job especially susanna who someone gets a jon anderson sound out of her voice if you did notmget vol 1 then get both as it is a surprisingly great job

sid and susie matthew sweet and susanna hoffs take on the 70s with just as much success as they did with their on the 60s on under the covers vol 1 even to a child of the 80s like myself who has not a particular fan of 70s jams this collection shows just how good some of the music really was back then hoffs is right on with her vocals and delivery and sweets musical sensibilities really make these classic songs shine while remaining fairly true to the originals i must add that it is particularly worth downloading the 10 extra bonus tracks here on amazon as some of these exclusive tracks are absolutely fantastic highly recommended

this is another really enjoyable listen the song selections are interesting and well chosen the cd is a fine listen in it is own right but also might make one go listen to the originals sweet and hoffs as well as all the folks who play on this are pros and it would be nice if they covered the eighties and nineties

take one of my all time favorite singer-songwriter-guitarists pair him with one of my all time favorite pop vocalists and have them record some of the greatest songs of the 1970s what do you get one of the most unnecessary recordings in history there is an effort on every one of these songs to duplicate note for note instrument for instrument and arrangement for arrangement the classic originals they are really talented musicians and do a credible job for the most part but in every single instance the original is far better and in a few willin in particular the cover is disastrous it is clear that these two have great taste my advice is to find each of these originals and make your own mix disc it will be awesome

this album proves two things 1 susanna hoffs can still sing like a bird and 2 the great songs of the seventies included here are still great after all these years it was wonderful hearing them redone by people who were young the first time these songs hit the charts probably the best song on the album is rod stewarts maggie sung by susannah a new depth of feeling is added but there is hardly a substandard selection on the whole album it is just great listening all the way through I have heard under the covers vol 2 twice and i can not wait to hear it again

this is a gem of an album i love every song i have not much cared much for their recent stuff ie red and green freaking love this one and a rocking toni braxton cover who else could pull that off ignore the haters and get it

has a few good songs but overall about as good as their last 3 cds at least it has some guitar solos which are rare in current weezer music from a once huge weezer fan who has gradually lost interest over the last few records starting with make believe all i can say is whatever

ok so I am reading all these reviews on this cd and everyone predominantly likes this weezer album i really do not know what to do with this cd odds and ends yes i just see it as weezer oweing geffen 1 more cd before departing for epitaph and heres 10 songs and we will call it death to false metal and now geffens off our backs do not get me wrong i love weezer and I am the one always defending rivers brilliance and some of the stuff they put out and I am always buying everything by them and i mean everything but this cd is out there way out there and the reviews look like plants by the record label yeah this cd is as good as the blue album yeah i put this cd on and was instantly hooked what ok bottomline this cd is for curious / hardcore weezer fans get it to have it i suppose but be warned and this is coming from a pretty hardcore fan I shall tell you what has a worthy buy bigtime the pinkerton deluxe cd s wow the album rolling stone gave 4 1/2 stars yeah get that first this one not really recommended

I am shocked this only a compilation and not an actual album some of these songs are real gems for those of you critizing this album keep in mind it is only a compilation of songs and not an actual album

so the album itself is fantastic i mean the unbreak my heart cover is reason enough to buy it but the album art is classic it totally looks like the artwork found on one of those tracts given out by jehovahs witnesses when they go door to door fantastic choice of artwork as usual
turning up the radio putting the cd in the car stereo and it is all the way up odd couple another great song

weezer has been releasing for almost 16 years now I have got most of their cds but most have not been their best since green in 2001 hurley is to me a pretty good comeback but this odds and ends album death to false metal is just a great piece of rock-pop by these guys the first 3 songs really get things going songs i recommend are the first three everyone odd couple and autopilot just a very fun disc

i love weezer the blue album was the first cd i ever bought and i love every single song on it they have put out other good albums since that one this album although is terrible there are two songs i like and one of them is a cover there are three songs that i dislike so much that I have removed them from my library the others are in between but usually i end up skipping them when they play the songs themselves are repetitive with not much melody or note change disappointed
i think it is a running joke how many bad albums they can make and how they can lose all the fans they once had it is like a slap in the face each time I am done weezer
the cd was of the highest quality arrived on time and was in perfect condition the product was as describedby the seller
I have been a weezer fan for awhile and i really liked this album much better than their past 4 efforts imho i added tracks 1 2 5 7 and 8 to my weezer playlist buy it you will not be disappointed

there are a lot of hit and misses on this b-side album notables are I am a robot i do not want you loving and my favorite autopilot there are some bad songs but mostly good i mix these with the notables from hurley and i get a complete 2010 weezer album that is worthy of the 1990s classics we love 35/5 stars
it is so sad how weezer continues to go downhill what a great band they were this album contnues their downhill slid what happened

this is supposed to be the leftovers from weezers previous albums some of the songs are better than on what were on the originals but that is of course a subjective opinion in short the album is great

are you kidding death to false metal-should be titled this is false metal this band is a joke an insult to all true musicians not my favorite band wouldn t take one of their albums if it was given to me free sorry weezer you suck

people are saying that weezer went down hill people could not be more wrong if you start from the beginning of weezer starting with the masterful blue album and progress you can see a change in the band a very slight change this is not a bad change it is maturity and more distinct sounds that people can relate to this album has a blast from a past with odd but pinkerton like songs it also has some new raditude not my favorite album like songs such as autopilot very catchy song there has the fast and fun burning my stack I am not suggesting this album is for everyone but it is for those die hard fans who own have early and later weezer albums and even the alone albums if you do not like the new album hurley this may be a stepping stone from early weezer into hurley if you loved the blue album and green album it has two or three songs that remind me of them and a whole lot like maladroit i suggest this album to those who want good clean fun

i give up I have been trying to like my favorite band for years and this crap has finally sent me off theweezer is dead to me can someone please do something about rivers and send him back into a spiraling depressed state so we can hear more albums like pinkerton farewell

there are some really great songs on this cd and overall i like it much better than hurley my favorite song is the odd couple very catchy and could easily be a radio hit when i listen to this cd and then listen to some of there newer cds I am baffled at how these could have been there b-sides when a lot of the songs on here are much more accessible to the greater population i really predict this cd will outsell hurley

death to false metal is apparently a compilation of songs that weezer did not think were good enough to make it on their last three or four records if that is the case this album is exactly what you would imagine a collection of really bad songs where weezer try their hardest to seem relevant to a younger audience sadly at a time when most successful artists would be maturing from great pop acts to timeless classics weezer continue to trash their reputation with the same pandering attempts to look cool in front of todays hipsters you guys are getting a little bit too old for that it is starting to look creepy death to false metal an album that contains b-sides from one of the worst 3 album runs in the history of popular music is truly the worst of the worst obsessed devotees will buy anyway but the rest of us are better off purchasing the pinkerton re-release

seems like all cuomo does anymore is make mediocre riffs and couple them with whining lyrics of the past the songs are boring predictable and mediocre ballads I had rather pour cement in my ears i do not know how anyone listens to this garbage the weez took a left turn into yesterdays news not too long ago and really has never returned I had say that speaks volumes about the extent of their talent i would not buy this cd if i were you i gave it a chance for the sake of the old songs and I am sorry to say I shall probably never pick up a weezer album ever again the weezy fanboys on here will say differently but even for a half-assed weezer fan this albums got to disappoint

for my 4th baby i wanted nursing bras that i could wear out of the house that were as supportive as my normal bras this one is perfect it is lined so you can not see nursing pads through it and it is comfortable and easy to nurse in the only reason i did not give it 5 stars is because the sizing is a bit off the band around the middle is smaller than usual and the cup size seems bigger than usual i had to try on a few before i found the right fit but once i did i was good to go and believe me i have tried many nursing bras this one has been great

i really like this bra the only problem that i have with it is the side wire pieces are uncomfortable one of them is trying to poke through the fabric already so this could use more padding and reinforcement other than that this is a good bra

i do not know who sizes these products but the cup size is too big by at least 2 i ordered the 36d and it was massively too big even for the 2 days when my milk came in that i was very engorged it is useless order small and return it if you need to
the bra could have been made better without the elastic staps that surround the breast it is uncomfortable

i bought this bra and when i got it washed and dryed it as the directions stated when i put it on immediately the wire popped out and stabbed me i am not happy with this bra and i plan to contact leadin lady the sad thing is besides the wire coming out it fits really well to bad

very supportive and great quality lasted the entire 15 months i nursed

i have used this nursing bra for several babies well worth the price best nursing bra i have ever used
to small and to pointy would not recommend buying this
i have owned these bras for 3 and a half months and the under wire broke on both of them i wear the bras roughly once a week wash in gentle cycle and line dry poor quality

when i first got this i was a bit weary because the cups had a kind of molded shape it seemed unnatural to me as i thought it looked funny to me i was wrong i ended up loving / getting used to this i love this nursing bra it has support with the underwire it is super comfy and it serves it is purpose very well so easy to clip on and off for nursing purposes and holds shape even if you are not in properly laughing out loud i would definitely recommend this i wish i had gotten this from the start

my boobs have been up in size and all around so i own pretty much every bra size now this pregnancy my breasts decided to settle on 36ddd or gargantuan as i like to refer to them 36ddd is hard to find and different companies fit slightly differently so i originally bought the 36dd but returned and got the 38dd which is working so far my cup doth not spillath over anymore and no side boob which is also a plus the band fits well on the middle hooks and gives good support straps feel soft against the skin but strong and thank god not rediculously wide so they are not noticeable under clothing the price is pretty awesome too for the quality i have spent up to 60 on one nursing bra thinking this will be the bra that changes my life and i like this one better for way less money I am giving a 5 star for all these reasons oh and the girls profile view is nicely rounded and natural looking not pointed weird or sad looking wahoo
this bra is amazing it fits prefect holds the girls up so well is super comfortable and very soft i want to buy like a million more

this bra is the last one i reach for in my arsenal of nursing bras the padding is stiff and very difficult to fold down to nurse when folded down it does not remain down so i have to tuck in under the underwire to be held in place which by the way tucking the padding is a chore in itself this is very frustrating especially when in public and trying to ready myself to feed my crying and squirmy hungry infant I have had people ask me if i were okay and if i needed help with something augh

the support is great the cup shape is a little too pointy for my liking although update yeah i do not like this bra the rubbery material on the band going around my chest is not breathable and digs into me why not leave it cotton I am about 140lbs and somewhat fit but this bra fits so terribly that it gives me back fat rolls I am convinced that it is that rubbery material added to the strap going around my chest i assume that it is to keep the bra in place but not being able to move with my body makes for unflattering rolls of skin popping out it is awful and i can not wait to get this bra off at the end of the day especially on hot days when that rubbery band just makes me sweat

have used these since having my son 2 1/2 years ago continued to wear them even after he weaned after a year of nursing now still using them nursing my second son i recommend them to anyone who asks what to use for a comfortable nursing bra with underwire love the coverage of the bra the amount of padding is just enough not too much and the nudedoes not show through white or other light colored shirts i wear these all day sometimes 18 hours and they never get uncomfortable at the end of the day i only take them off to sleep and shower they do start to wear a bit on the top inside of the bra just below the nursing clasp since that part folds down each time you nurse this eventually causes the seam to give but even then they still work well these are a great product and value considering most other underwire nursing bras cost far more and are far less comfortable not super stylish but they do the job they are intended for
fits well but material wrinkles under clothing a bit like too much material just at the nipple part however very comfortable and functional

unfortunately this bra is too small around the chest the cups are also way too small and inflexible which would not allow enough give for engorged breasts

after nursing for 2 years i really wanted a molded cup padded underwire bra to give a better shape and make me feel a little more normal again i searched for a while and am glad i purchased this one the price is great for a nursing bra and i have seen much more expensive ones at specialty stores and online the underwire is comfortable and although i wish it was slightly more padded i was happy with this it looks great under any garment but the sides do come a little higher than some of my other bras so i have to make sure that the shirt i choose covers it under my arms it is easy to nurse in and once the top is clipped back up it does not take long for the padding to smooth out again I have worn it out after about a year as the underwire is starting to poke through the fabric so it is time for a new one and i would definitely purchase this again

so I have bought at least 8 nursing bras in the 7 months since I have had my son this one is my favorite so far i have rather large breast and it provides good support and shape but is still comfortable it lost a star just because it is full coverage and i can not wear with some tops

i have had a hard time finding a nursing bra with underwire for bigger busts and this one is perfect i have two of them and they are the only ones i will wear it seems a little tight at first but does loosen up some as it is worn a bit which was perfect because it seemed a little small for the size i needed when the outer cups pop down the inner holsters around the breast are complete rather than just one sided and are great for nursing only downfall of this set up is it is not particularly easy to get your breast back into the cup with one hand in any position that looks even slightly normal a little awkward for nursing in public but can be done overall i love it and recommend it edit and star change after years of using these bras exclusively something changed i do not know if they changed manufacturers or what but the new bras I have ordered this year have been horrible they are tight in weird places the cups do not hold they dig and are insanely stiff i no longer recommend this product

the cup folds down right at nipple level so this may work for pumping but it is terrible for breastfeeding because the baby can not get a latch on anything more than the nipple it teaches a bad latch in my opinion I am keeping it only for pumping

tried it on and there were weird dimples in the middle of the cups openings for nursing the cup and band size seemed to be correct for me but the bra cups were just terrible i returned this immediately and would not recommend this product to anyone unless you like looking like you have deflated boobs

been having a hard time finding a nursing bra that gave me good support and made my boobs look normal I am a dd and almost an e and most nursing bras are horribly unsupportive i bought this based on the reviews i like it gives good support comfortable and a nice shape closet thing to a normal bra that i have found it has molded cups so it hides the nursing pads well the snaps are good an sturdy so far it is been a great bra and reasonably priced I have always worn underwire bras as have never found a bra without underwires that gave me support it is a great bra for daytime under your normal clothes the only thing that is kind of annoying is the molded cups while i like them for hiding nursing pads and such it is a bit annoying to have to push the molded cup down out of the way to nurse or pump that is the reason i have 4 stars and not 5 other than that definitely worth the purchase fits pretty true to size
this bra has a great shape that stays it fits great and i would recommend this for any nursing mother i will buy this again
overall the bra fits great and allows for great mobility i love the support of the inside the design is especially great for larger chested women

the perfect nursing bra for out of the house i have other sleeping nursing bras but i would not wear them out of the house this one looks and feels just like a regular bra only with great quick nursing access

this bra is perfect and comfortable this is the second one and i love them both perfect for nursing and durable

i bought this bra based on it is good reviews i bought it just a little over a month ago it is true to size and i found it to be very comfortable my problem with it is that it is ripping and fraying just after a month of wearing it i am very disappointed in the poor quality of the bra
great fit true to size gives great support comfy one hand clip works perfectly fine will definitely buy another after looping months of trying to find the perfect bra for nursing

i really like this product and i would recomend everyone to get this it is great good and efficient product

this bra is great i am very glad i made this purchase i am rather large and this bra gives great support it does have an underwire but i have not noticed it affecting my milk production at all i used the sizing suggestions given by others and it fits perfectly the only problem with it that i have had is that after only about a month the underwire started popping out of the bra so i had to sew it back in place other than that i must say that i really do love this bra and would highly recommend it

i love this bra i was searching high and wide for a nice neutral t shirt nursing bra that gave good support and was high enough on the middle and sides to contain my breasts i am a 34d and it can be hard to find a decent full coverage nursing bra that lifts and seperates my breasts that seem to be made ofthese days this bra really does the trick it is extremely supportive without looking so the underwire and the inner sling that resembles a triangle with an opening for your areola really keeps your breasts in place and that is with running around a bending over to pick up after a 4 year old all day even with it being so supportive the straps are not ugly and thick and the bra looks normal it is also really cheap yet made well the snap is easily undone with one hand it is so comfortable that i literally slept in it the first night i got it and wore it the entire next day-and it left no red marks or chafing in any areas most bras always irritate me at night highly reccommend
this book was a totally different change of pace after some of the predictable ones I have been reading recently disturbing but a great read and will keep you thinking

small but perfectly formed that is al guthrie for you this is one of the splendid series of novellas published by five leaves in killing mum carlos morales does odd jobs for people several of those odd jobs involve offing people when carlos receives a padded envelope one day it is a good news bad news sort of affair the good news is that a mystery client will pay him 20000 to kill valerie anderson the bad news is that valerie anderson is his mother oh and there has more bad news he suspects the woman he loves of being the one who wants his mother dead dark warped and funny and with a surprising number of twists and turns for such a short book i read it in one sitting alternately giggling and gasping strangely enough i had a whole train carriage to myself by the end of it loved it loved it loved it

you have to keep mum about killing mum because as other reviewers have noted it is hard to say too much without spoilers it is about a for-hire hit-man who is given a lot of money to kill his own mother he has both cool about it and curious he has prepared to do it but would like to know who wants him to do it is it his wife is it even the mother guthries writing is strong on dialogue which many writers find hard to do convincingly some writers talk tough but their characters just end up sounding manufactured elmore leonard is a master of great natural dialogue and while guthries characters are a world away from leonards they have that same tough-sounding realism i liked what one reviewer said about blood simple that is a really good comparison like the coen brothers movie it is gritty noir yet also occasionally comic and the characters are totally real by the way one reviewer referred to problems with the kindle version but I have read the kindle version and did not see any problems at all or maybe i was just too engrossed in the story

killing mum is a short sharp shocker true brit grit the novella is as tight as a very tight thing and is a spin off from guthries cracking novel savage night it is the story of a man who is paid to kill his own mother like savage night killing mum takes a violently absurd and tragically comic situation and gives it a couple of dark and bitter twists it is like having blood simple transported to modern day scotland and is a rush of a read five bloody stars

killing mum immediately sucks you in with a dark calculating main character that nonchalantly embraces his life as an assassins agent a quick read that you will not be able to put down the kindle version seems to have a few errors that are periodically annoying hopefully they will be fixed in a revised version

a true modern master of noir and crime fiction allan guthrie packs a wallop with his gut punch of a novella a sweet little package from crime express called killing mum carlos is a man who arranges killings for a fee of course a letter arrives addressed charlie a name only his wife and mother use for him the letter contains the down payment and instructions for a job but there has a hitch the intended target is none other than carlos mother and it all goes downhill from there guthrie is able to amp up the suspense right from the get go and it just never let up throughput the 96 page run and yeah thank the maker it is not a novel length story because damn it will nearly wear you out as it is any longer you might just need an ambulance the plot moves swift and we for the most part learn about the characters via dialogue and action it is a tight and tense story and without fail one you will not soon forget

liked the story line here was just incredible i can not write too much as i do not want to give spoilers i will say that the character development is very good for the main character i enjoy the way this author draws you into a story forcing you to turn just one more page to find out what happens next disliked again hard to tell without spoilers so i will just say that the author used a particular type of formatting that kind of gave away the twist way too early overall a terrific fast read length novella rating r for violence language and sexual references

this starts out great but in the end is so convoluted that it is just a narcissistic piece of junk it is sad that most of the story is made up of swear words maybe if more time had been spend on the storyline and less on how many times the f-bomb could be dropped
the beginning was ok but the story never took off and it got quite confusing can not say i liked it but it was short and free
it was really interesting but just different from crime novels also intriguing only thing i did not like was the way it ended not knowing who really wanted the mother dead
i felt that it was off the wall and not worth the time to read it the guy is crazy at the end and i did not understand why it had to be that way
the storyline was well written it had me interested quickly and kept my interest throughout the book i think most people would enjoy this book
the book jumped from one thing to another the cursing in the book just made it worse i did not enjoy the book at all
this book did not have a real beginning or an ending weird left the reader with a lot of unanswered questions do not recommend anybody killing their mum
story has no redeeming feature complete waste of time i gave it a one because zero was not an option
i love mysteries but the mystery should be what the story is about and not trying to understand the story i still am not sure what happened in this book one good thing it was very short
it started out okay and went down hill from there ridiculous plot but i kept hoping for more and kept reading waste of time in my opinion
guthries fiction is tough dark and extremely funny not for the squeamish if you like noir fiction you will like guthrie

short story so a short review dark witty tale set in a slightly surreal edinburgh hitmen tanning salons wee neds with guns and body bags it is tarantino with salt an sauce and at 74p less than a bag of chips

killing mum started out to be a really great story but kind of went downhill from there maybe i just do not do well with short stories the first chapter was good in setting up what promised to be an out of the ordinary thriller then it seemed as if the author just wanted to get it over with because he tried to cram too much information into the next two chapters the book became bogged down and confusing it is a shame too because i did enjoy the writing style at first and thought that i had stumbled onto another good author
i am a musician i found these speakers to be very limited in range i bought them because of the raving reviews by customers they are very high ended lacking in mid-range and have no low end sound

wow these babies are smaller than i imagined i put them in a cd bag with 10 cds my mp3 player and still had room stereo in a pack the speakers are crisp and the surround sound is phenomenal give me more of this for my travel lifestyle thanks

for 20 these are very impressive little speakers they look a lot chaper than they sound the cardboard-like grill did not impress me but give them a chance they impressed me a lot once i truned them on and i am an audiophile the mid bass and the highs are much cleaner than i expected there is no deep bass but i expected that also the surround effect is nice especially when you have the spakers placed on your work table at near-ear level great for travel as they are very compact however if you want pounding bass you should maybe look into a subwoofer design but then again those will not be so compact and inexpensive good job sonic

just spent the last month checking the internet for portable speakers to take on vacation i wanted something as small as possible good sound and a modest price when i first saw the price of the si-5 i thought they can not sound very good for that price but after reading all the reviews on amazoncom and a few other sites i decided to purchase these if they turned out not so great sounding i could return them and start my quest all over again i bought them this past saturday at bestbuy and hooked them up almost immediately to my sony md walkman all i can say is what a surprise i would definitely recommend these to anyone looking for compactness good sound and an incredibly great price in travel speakers i only regret not waiting another day because circuit city here had them on sale for 1799 and i also had a 500 off coupon which would have brought the price down to 1299 that would have been an even more incredible bargain for what you are getting for the little bit of money being spent

these speakers are well designed and give a good but not great sound highs are bright and crisp but slightly wobbly midrange is fine and bass is present but somewhat weak sounds best at moderate volume one of the key things for me is portability and here is where this system shines the speaker / amp package is great for travel or just toting about town to start with it is very light the form is also also thoughtfully designed the two speakers clip togeather to form a package slightly thicker than a standard cd jewel case this also protects the papery speaker fabric the tiny amp is sculpted so that it fits your hand and the wires are plugged at poth ends and detachable be sure to have a clip or rubberband around to keep the wires together after you dissassemble i can not belive how inexpensive it is you will not be sorry if you buy this but even if by some odd chance you were it is not much dough out of your pocket

i bought these to use with my ipod i just could not see spending the 100 - 150 for the high end altec lansing and creativ speaker units especially given the fact that reviews seem to be love em or hate em for those models as well i quite like these speakers the sound quality is good and reasonably full with jazz classical or rock music true given the rather limited output these would not be suitable for a display at a convention or a raging party but they are perfect for a hotel room quiet dorm or office yes there are three wires 2 for the speakers the other from the music source ipod mp3 but the advantage is that you can space the speakers farther apart then with other speakers I have seen the unit does not come with a power adaptor but has an input for one which can be purchased on the manufacturers website [ ] otherwise it uses 4 aaa batteries

i read mixed reviews so i rolled theand bought these absolute garbage in their little bag they are 3 thick they sound very quiet no bass expected and no mid-range not expected the front panel is a cheap corrugated plastic sheet they certainly are 360 degree speakers they sound equally bad from all directions even the patch cables that they provided had breaks in the cables my original comment to my wife was twenty bucks how can i go wrong well my answer now is i could have still had my 20 now i just have to find someone to give them to as they are not worth the space they take up i know you get what you pay for but if that was the case here then should have been on sale for half off at the 99 cent store

i got this for my frequent backpacking trips with my buddies and the quality of these speakers blew everyone including myself away every time i turn this on i still get amaze with how some 4 oz speakers could sound so rich and loud relative to it is size and weight if you are a outdoor freak and weight on your back is away an issue go for this and prepare to amaze your friends when they hear a live concerto streaming out from inside your tent total weight with batteries 1 pound 4 oz carry it on my 38 pound bag not an issue battery-share with my walkie eating real food and listening to a live concert while your friends are having problem trying to start a fire to cook instant noodle priceless

when you look at their size they are the size of a cd jewel case you would think they can not be that good but these speakers are great the sound is awesome of course you would not expect a great sound in a large room but for a small office or bedroom they are fantastic the only problem is the unit which connects the 2 speakers this contains the on switch and batteries if you forget to shut the switch off you drain your batteries rather quickly and it is easy to do this at first otherwise the speakers are great and quite portable

i bought these speakers to take on vacations with my mp3 player and they actually have pretty good sound for their size however after only two uses one of the speakers lost it is sound unless you press on the face of it i would suggest buying any other speakers but these

these speakers are the worst that i have ever come across and broke down a week after i got them the sound is decent in the beginning but nothing around above average standards no way i would ever recommend any one buy one of these just are not worth the dough looks decent but that is where the good stuff ends

these speakers are the best the best for your money the best for sound quality and the best for dvd portable players if you are looking for bass spend more money and get good advice as to what you need for what you are buying for thoughs who under rate these speakers go get a job and put your sound system in the garbage

i bought these speakers to use with my toshiba satelite 2805-s402 laptop unfortunately i found that these speakers were not a significant improvement over my laptop speakers they are very small and they snap together handily making them great for traveling but i would only buy them for use with a discman mp3 player or something similar that has no speaker function

yes these are small and light now the bad news the separate amplifier and all the wires going everywhere makes the connected assembly look like a science lab project especially if you opt for the usb power connector yes the sound quality is better than the one inch speakers in my ibm thinkpad but not nearly as good as your typical 19 desktop computer speakers the problem is that the sound is limited to highs with little if any midrange bass is nonexistent it is like listening to a pair of big tweeters the enthusiastic reviews are a mystery to me

i enjoy watching dvds on my laptop but lugging my desktop speakers in a bag did not appeal to me now i literally slip these speakers into my laptop cases outer pocket and I am on my way they snap together and are one and a half inches at their thickest i show off these speakers every chance i get and the reaction is always one of amazement now while they are not the equal of my desktop speakers they are 25 times better than my laptop the surround sound effect makes a real difference when heard for the very first time while a bit pricey for most people if you own a portable dvd player or a laptop you will increase the value of your product and your audio-visual experience many times over i also use them with my mini disc unit in new york city where things have to be just a little bit louder to be heard these speakers impress

easily the best portable speakers out there and probably the only portable speakers that are not more then glorified headphones the sound is rich and full although the bass will hardly rattle your teeth the speakers are incrediably compact about the size of a double cd jewel case the i-mac-esquescheme is an aquired taste am i the only one that misses the days when computers and electronics only came in black silver and putty for a pair of speakers to throw in with your laptop mp3 player or portable cd player there has nothing better pros superior sound very compact easy to set up fairly long battery life cons [ light ] plasic and cardboard construction somewhat pricy weak bass questionable looks seperate amplifier this is a very good effort and i hope sonic impact tries again make it with heavier plastic integrate the amplifier into one or both of the speakers raise the bass a tad bundle it with a compact dc adapter or better yet a usb power option and lower the price into the sub-50 dollar range and this would be a breakthrough product

the unit works well after sorting through all the wires thefrom the music source is extremely short and requires some dexterity the biggest complaint is the battery cover which refuses to stay on with modest handling also the on-off switch is cheaply constructed and i found it prudent to remove the batteries when travelling switch activated when travelling and caused battery loss a neat gadget for the price sound quality is more than reasonable for the weight and compactness

these speakers would have been a perfect compliment to my portable dvd player due to their size and portability however the volumn was minimal even after purchasing new batteries these speakers were beautiful in appearance but wiring could be more substantial speakers should be shipped with dc power supply to improve performance

got it for a couple of weeks it has been great took me a while to figure out how to connect to my reciever for the 51 feature picture quality has been excellent tried it with a vcd and it works fine but i think my vcd was a poor quality vcd karaoke works too so far no complaint from me

last week saw the ad tried to order and can not sucess so tried again a moment ago but the price was already jumped up 1000 that means if i do not order to-day and to-morrow will jump up again so may be i have to wait another month wait for it for sale then i am going to order thanks

this is a good unit but beware it has trouble playing variable bitrate svcds if your svcd bitrate drops below a certain level the picture will freeze and the audio will emit a high pitched squeal if svcd playback is important to you get a different player otherwise you will be ok with the ad-800

this is a great dvd player it has everything you want even comes with mp3 at a price you can not beat it has a karaoke mode which is a lot of fun it is such a good buy it is easy to set up and easy to use a great first dvd player for anyone who is thinking of getting a dvd player i would not use it on my hdtv home theater but if you just want something simple that looks great this is the one it has good sound and picture for the price have not had any problems with it what can i say i love it it was cool big truck

i bought this unit the day after christmas i have since spent many hours in front of it besides playing almost every format of disc known it is firmware upgradable so it will likely keep pace with new formats as they become available one reviewer said that it was not user-friendly do not confuse a great degree of user-selectable preferences as being complicated novice users can play it right out of the box but power users will find it ultimately enjoyable plus with progressive scan i will be able to use this player even after i upgrade to a digital tv and the price speaks for itself apex is breaking new ground by offering high end products at k-mart prices keep up the good work

it is probably the best around for the price although it can be sluggish and tempermental it gives you an unbelievable amount of control from zooming and panning to speaker tweaking you can do anything you would ever need to with the touch of a button the mp3 control is very strange and almost old fashioned but it puts out great sound the remote is interesting and takes some time to adjust to but gets the job done and the unit itself is freakishly huge it is almost twice as big as my vcr but not that intrusive so if you like having complete control over your dvd viewing and love features galore this is definitely the dvd player for you

my new apex ad-800 provided good picture and sound on dvds but could not read half of my vcds commercially produced vcds i think the laser is out of alignment i found the unit to be very user-unfriendly the remote control is poorly laid out and performing a simple fast forward / reverse task is painful the unit does not automatically switch between 43 and 169 aspect ratio wheras my panasonic does so i have to manually set the aspect ratio each time i switch from a widescreen dvd to a vcd or a 43 dvd i have read reviews that tout the ad-800 as a great toy for a technical person due to it is many user-adjustable parameter settings but i think the unit had so many user-adjustable parameters because it lacks the intelligence to set them automatically the karaoke function is very limited as it has no ability to adjust the key and no vocal assist function i had high hopes for the ad-800 due to it is many advertised features but i am quite disappointed by the poor quality control and user-unfriendliness

had this dvd and worked until red lines appeared on led screen took unit apart and noticed exploded power supply component the unti still plays cds but can not get a dvd to play apex tech support is horrible they want be to ship the unit back in the original box

i have had my ad-800 for over a year and it works well there are 2 versions out there that i am aware of the newer version works better than the older one the beauty of this is that it does a great job converting pal ntsc while not region free it has the complete look feel ' and quality of the malata in fact if it was not for the apex label it seems like it is exactly like the [ expensive ] malata it does the 169 correctly in pal ntsc and you can adjust the aspect if needed great features for the price there are some issues with the progressive scan but overall it does a relatively good job heck i would say that for the price it does a fantastic job also with some of the newer high-end tvs some of the deinterlacers on the tvs are better than the dvd players anyway so you may not need it in the future i tried svcd and vcd and both worked well for me note i do not use mp3 or photo

if you are thinking of buy this dvd player for the progressive scan do not i have a 57 toshiba hdtv and when you turn on the progressive mode on this dvd player the picture gets worse it is grainy blurry and dull interlaced mode looks better plus this player will sometimes burp meaning sound / picture pauses or seems to skip a second or two like it can not keep up i thought i was planning for the future when i bought this player but i wished i saved my money for a better player later
